verses.text:
How fortunate are those who do not do what the wicked people advise them to do,
\q1 who do not imitate the behavior of sinful people,
\q1 and who do not join with people who ridicule God.
\q1

Instead, those with whom Yahweh is pleased delight in understanding what he teaches us.
\q2 They read and think every day and every night about what Yahweh teaches. 
\q1

They constantly do things that please God,
\q2 just as fruit trees that have been planted along the banks of a stream produce fruit at the right time every year.
\q1 Like trees that never wither,
\q2 they succeed in everything that they do.
\b
\q1

But wicked people are not like that!
\q2 Wicked people are as worthless as chaff
\q2 that is blown away by the wind.
\q1

Therefore, when God judges all mankind, he will condemn the wicked.
\q2 Furthermore, the wicked will not be present when Yahweh gathers all the righteous people together.
\q1

For Yahweh guides and protects righteous people,
\q2 but the path that the wicked walk on leads them to where God will destroy them forever.

Why do the leaders of nations rage against Yahweh?
\q2 Why do people plan to rebel against him, even though it is in vain?
\q1

They shout, "We should free ourselves from their control;
\q2 we should not let them rule over us any longer!"
\b
\q1

Then, because he is angry with them, he rebukes them.
\q2 He causes them to be terrified when they realize that he will furiously punish them.
\q1

Yahweh says, "I have put my king on a throne on Zion, my sacred hill in Jerusalem."
\q1

His king says, "I will proclaim what Yahweh has decreed.
\q1 He said to me, 'You are my son;
\q2 today I have become your father.
\q1

Request me to give you the nations
\q2 so that they belong to you permanently,
\q2 and I will give them to you.
\q1 Even the most remote nations will be yours.
\q1

You will strike them down with an iron rod; 
\q2 like the potter crashes his pot into pieces when he throws it on the ground,
\q2 that is how you will break them up into small pieces.
\b
\q1

So then, you kings and other rulers on the earth, act wisely!
\q2 Listen to what Yahweh is warning you!
\q1

Worship Yahweh; fervently honor him.
\q2 Rejoice about the things he has done, but tremble before him!
\q1

Bow down humbly before his son!
\q2 If you do not do that, he will be angry,
\q2 and he will suddenly kill you.
\q1 Do not forget that he can, in one moment, show that he is very angry!
\q2 But how fortunate are all those who request him to protect them.

\d A psalm written by David when he was fleeing from his son Absalom
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I have many enemies!
\q2 There are many people who oppose me.
\q1

Many people are saying about me,
\q2 "God will certainly not help him."
\qr 
\b
\q2

But Yahweh, you are like a shield that protects me.
\q1 You greatly honor me, and you encourage me.
\q1

I cry out to you, Yahweh,
\q2 and you answer me from Zion, your sacred hill.
\qr 
\b
\q1

At night I lay down and slept, and I woke up in the morning
\q2 because you, Yahweh, took care of me all during the night.
\q1

There may be thousands of enemy soldiers who surround me,
\q2 but I am not afraid.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, arise!
\q2 My God, come and rescue me again!
\q1 You will insult my enemies by slapping them on their cheeks;
\q2 when you strike them, you will destroy their power,
\q2 with the result that they cannot hurt anyone.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you are the one who saves your people from their enemies.
\q2 Yahweh, bless your people!
\qr

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director; a psalm to be accompanied by people playing stringed instruments
\b
\q1

God, answer me when I pray to you.
\q2 You are the one who shows people that I am right to trust in you.
\q1 You rescued me when I was in great trouble.
\q2 Act mercifully toward me and listen to me while I pray.
\q1

How long will you people shame me instead of honoring me?
\q2 You people love to falsely accuse me.
\qr
\b
\q1

All those who honor Yahweh—
\q2 he has chosen them to belong to him.
\q1 Yahweh will listen to me when I pray to him.
\b
\q1

You should be afraid of Yahweh, but do not allow your fear to cause you to sin.
\q1 While you lie on your bed,
\q2 silently examine what you are thinking in your inner being.
\qr
\q1

Also, offer to Yahweh the proper sacrifices
\q2 and continue trusting in him.
\b
\q1

Some people ask, "Will somone please bring good things to us?"
\q2 But I say, "Yahweh, continue to act kindly toward us.
\q1

It is in peace and security that I will lie down at night and sleep soundly
\q2 because I know that it is only you, Yahweh, who will keep me safe."

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director; a psalm to be accompanied by playing flutes
\b
\q1

Yahweh, listen to me while I pray!
\q2 Pay attention to me when I am groaning because I am suffering very much.
\q1

You are my king and my God.
\q1 When I call to you to request you to help me, listen to me
\q2 because you are the one to whom I pray.
\q1

You listen to me when I pray to you each morning,
\q2 and I wait for you to reply.
\b
\q1

You do not allow those who are proud to come to you to worship you.
\q2 You hate all those who do evil things.
\q1

You get rid of liars,
\q2 and you despise those who murder others and those who deceive others.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, because you greatly and faithfully love me,
\q2 I come into your temple.
\q1 I have an awesome respect for you
\q2 and I will bow down to worship you at your sacred temple.
\q1

Yahweh, because you act righteously toward me,
\q2 show me what is right for me to do.
\q1 Because I have many enemies,
\q2 show me clearly how to live in the right way.
\b
\q1

My enemies never say what is true;
\q2 in their inner beings they want to destroy others.
\q1 They speak threats of violence and death.
\q2 They use their tongues to say good things to please people.
\q1

O God, declare that they are guilty and punish them.
\q2 Cause them to experience the same disasters that they plan to cause to happen to others.
\q1 Get rid of them because they have committed many sins,
\q2 and they have rebelled against you.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you always bless those who act righteously;
\q2 you protect them as a soldier protects himself with his shield.

\d A psalm written by David for the choir leader, to be accompanied by people playing stringed instruments
\b
\q1

Yahweh, act kindly toward me and heal me because I have become weak.
\q2 My body shakes because I am experiencing so much sorrow.
\q1

Yahweh, I am greatly troubled in my inner being.
\q2 How long must I endure this?
\b
\q1

Yahweh, please come and rescue me.
\q2 Save me because you always keep the promises of your covenant.
\q1

I will not be able to praise you after I die;
\q2 no one in the place where the dead are praise you.
\b
\q1

I am exhausted because of my pain.
\q2 I cry all night long so that my bed and my pillow are drenched by my tears.
\q1

Because I cry so much, I cannot see well.
\q2 My eyes have become weak because I constantly cry in fear of my enemies.
\b
\q1

You people who do evil things, get away from me,
\q2 because Yahweh heard me when I was crying!
\q1

Yahweh heard me when I called out for him to help me,
\q2 and he will answer my prayer.
\q1

When that happens, all my enemies will be ashamed;
\q2 they will be the ones who are terrified.
\q1 They will turn away from me and suddenly leave me
\q2 because they will be disgraced.

Yahweh my God, I come to you to protect me.
\q2 Rescue me, save me from all those who are pursuing me in order to harm me.
\q1

If you do not do that, they will tear me into pieces
\q2 like a lion does when it attacks the animals it wants to kill;
\q2 no one will save me from them.
\b
\q1

Yahweh my God, suppose that I have done anything that is wrong,
\q2

or that I have done evil to some friend,
\q2 or that, for no good reason, I have harmed my enemies.
\q1

Then allow my enemies to pursue me and capture me.
\q1 Allow them to trample me into the ground
\q2 and leave me lying dead in the dirt.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, because you are very angry with those who pursue me,
\q2 arise and attack the ones attacking me!
\q1 Do to them what you have said is just!
\q1

The people of all nations gather around you to attack you,
\q2 but you will rule them from where you are in heaven.
\q1

Yahweh, judge the people of all nations!
\q2 Yahweh, show that I have done nothing wrong.
\q1

God, you know what every person is thinking in his inner being
\q2 and because you are righteous, you always do what is just.
\q1 So now stop evil people from doing wicked deeds,
\q2 and defend all of us who are righteous!
\b
\q1

You judge everyone correctly,
\q2 and every day you punish wicked people who insult your law.
\q1

Whenever your enemies do not repent,
\q2 it is as though you sharpen your sword and put a string on your bow to get ready to kill them.
\q1

Wicked people plot their lies and evil things,
\q2 they plan and take delight in their thoughts like a pregnant woman who is planning to give birth.
\q1

But when they dig a deep pit to trap others,
\q2 they themselves will fall into it.
\q1

They themselves will experience the trouble that they want to cause others to have;
\q2 they will hurt themselves by the violent things that they want to do to others.
\b
\q1

I praise Yahweh because he always acts righteously;
\q2 I sing to praise Yahweh, the one who is much greater than any other god.

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director, to be accompanied by a stringed instrument
\b
\q1

Yahweh our Lord, people all over the world know that you are very great!
\q2 We see your greatness every time we look toward the heavens!
\q1

I look up at the sky at night
\q2 and see the things that you have made—
\q2 the moon and the stars that you have set in place.
\q1

It is amazing to me that you think about people,
\q2 that you are concerned about us humans!
\q1

the sheep and the cattle,
\q2 and even the wild animals,
\q1

the birds, the fish,
\q2 and everything else that swims in the seas.
\q1

Yahweh our Lord,
\q2 people all over the world know that you are very great!

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director, to be sung using the tune 'The death of my son'
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I will praise you with all of my inner being.
\q2 I will tell others about all the wonderful things that you have done.
\q1

I will sing to celebrate what you, who are much greater than all other gods, have done.
\b
\q1

When my enemies realize that you are very powerful,
\q2 they stumble, and then they are killed.
\q1

You sit on your throne to judge people,
\q2 and you have judged fairly concerning me.
\q1

You rebuked the people of other nations,
\q2 and you have gotten rid of the wicked people;
\q2 you have erased their names forever.
\q1

Our enemies have disappeared;
\q2 you destroyed their cities,
\q2 and people do not even remember them anymore.
\b
\q1

But Yahweh rules forever.
\q2 He judges people while he sits on his throne.
\q1

Those who know Yahweh trust in him;
\q2 he never abandons those who come to him for help.
\b
\q1

Yahweh rules on Mount Zion;
\q2 praise him and sing to him.
\q1 Tell the people of all the nations the marvelous things that he has done.
\q1

He does not forget to punish those who have murdered others;
\q2 he will punish them,
\q2 and he will not ignore people who are crying because they are suffering.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, act mercifully toward me!
\q1 Look at the ways that my enemies have injured me.
\q2 Do not allow me to die because of these injuries.
\q1

I want to live in order that I can praise you at the gates of Jerusalem 
\q2 and to rejoice because you rescued me.
\q1

It is as though the wicked people of many nations have dug a pit for me to fall into,
\q2 but they have fallen into that same pit.
\q1 It is as though they have spread out a net to catch me,
\q2 but their feet have been caught in that same net.
\q1

Because of what you have done, people know that you make justice happen;
\q2 you allow wicked people to be trapped by the same evil things that they themselves do.
\b
\q1

But you will not forget those who are needy;
\q2 what they confidently expect will never be in vain.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, do not allow our enemies to conquer us 
\q just because they are strong;
\q You see what the people do and you bring justice to them all. 
\q1

Yahweh, teach them that they must be afraid of you and honor you.
\q2 Cause them to know that they are only human beings.

Yahweh, why do you keep yourself far away from us?
\q2 Why do you not pay attention when we have troubles?
\b
\q1

Proud, wicked people, have a terrible desire within them to make poor people suffer.
\q2 God, make them fall into their own traps, so that what they did to others may be done to them!
\q1

The wicked person boasts about the evil things he wants to do.
\q2 He desires to own the things that others have, and he does not want them to own more things than he has. 
\q2 He boasts about all the things he owns, while he curses you, Yahweh.
\q1

The wicked person is so proud
\q2 he never looks for God 
\q2 and if he did look for God, he would not find him.
\q2 He is too proud to even think about God. 
\q1

But, looking at the life of the wicked man, 
\q2 it seems that everything he does is successful. 
\q2 He cannot even understand your commands, God, 
\q2 and then he mocks his enemies.
\q1

In his mind he thinks, "Nothing bad can happen to me!
\q2 As long as I live, I will never have troubles."
\q1

When he speaks he always curses and tells lies, 
\q2 and he makes threats against others.
\q2 When he talks, he only speaks about hurting or destroying other people.
\q1

He makes plans to attack the people living in the villages, people who have done nothing wrong.
\q2 He waits in places where he can hide 
\q2 while he keeps looking for more people he can attack, 
\q2 people who cannot defend themselves.
\q1

He waits for his victims like a lion who crouches down, 
\q2 and just like the lion, he hides in the bushes.
\q2 He is like the hunter who spreads out the net 
\q2 so he can catch helpless people and drag them away.
\b
\q1

The helpless people are crushed by the wicked person's plans 
\q2 and all the things he does. 
\q2 He is powerful, and when he opposes the helpless people, 
\q2 he always takes away from them whatever he wants. 
\q1

The wicked person says, "God cannot remember what I did.
\q2 His eyes are covered, and he cannot see anything that I have done."
\b
\q1

Yahweh, arise! God, strike him down!
\q2 Do not forget those who are suffering!
\q1

Why does the most wicked person curse you, God, and turn away from you?
\q2 Does he think, "God can never punish me"?
\q1

God, you do see the trouble and the distress that the wicked person causes.
\q2 And you will strike the wicked man and punish him for all that he does.
\q1

God, destroy the power of the person who is wicked and evil!
\q2 Make him pay for those evil things he did, 
\q2 those things that he thought God would not find out about him. 
\b
\q1

Yahweh is king forever!
\q2 He will drive out foreign people from his land.
\q1

Yahweh, when the people who suffer cry out to you, you listen.
\q2 You hear them when they pray and you encourage them.
\q1

You defend the orphans and oppressed people 
\q2 when the strong and the wicked work to do them harm.
\q2 And so, no one has to worry or be terrified anymore.

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director
\b
\q1

I trust that Yahweh will protect me.
\q2 So I do not fly off to the mountains like birds do.
\q1

It is true that wicked people have hidden in the darkness,
\q1 that they have pulled back their bowstrings and aimed their arrows
\q2 to shoot them at people who honor Yahweh.
\q1

When wicked people do not suffer for disobeying the laws,
\q2 what can righteous people do?
\b
\q1

But Yahweh is sitting on his throne in his sacred temple in heaven,
\q2 and he sees everything that people do.
\q1

Yahweh examines what righteous people do and what wicked people do,
\q2 and he hates those who love to injure others.
\q1

He will send down from the sky flaming coals and burning sulfur on the wicked;
\q2 he will send scorching hot winds to punish them.
\b
\q1

Yahweh does everything that is right, and he loves those who do what is right;
\q2 such people will come into his presence.

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director
\b
\q1

Yahweh, help us! It seems like people who honor you are no more,
\q2 that those who are loyal to you have all vanished.
\q1

Everyone tells lies to other people;
\q2 they deceive others by flattering them, but they tell lies.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, we wish that you would cut off their tongues
\q2 so that they cannot continue to boast.
\q1

They say, "By telling lies we will get what we want;
\q2 we control what we say, so no one can tell us what we should do!"
\b
\q1

But Yahweh replies, "I have seen the violent things that they have done to helpless people;
\q2 I have heard those people groaning,
\q2 so I will arise and rescue the people who are wanting me to help them."
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you always do what you have promised to do;
\q2 what you have promised is as precious and pure as silver
\q2 that has been heated seven times in a furnace to get rid of all the impure material.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, we know that you will protect us who honor you
\q2 from those wicked people,
\q2

those who strut around proudly,
\q2 while people praise them for doing evil deeds.

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director
\b
\q1

Yahweh, how long will you continue to forget about me?
\q2 Will you hide yourself from me forever?
\q1

How long must I endure anguish within myself?
\q2 Must I be miserable every day?
\q2 How long will my enemies continue to defeat me?
\b
\q1

Yahweh my God, look at me and answer me.
\q2 Give me strength, or I will die.
\q1

Do not allow my enemies to boast and to say, "We have defeated him!"
\q2 Do not allow them to defeat me,
\q2 with the result that they will rejoice about it!
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you have done many good things for me,
\q2 so I will sing to you.

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director
\b
\q1

Only foolish people say to themselves, "There is no God!"
\q1 People who say those things only do corrupt deeds;
\q2 there is not one of them who does what is good.
\b
\q1

From heaven Yahweh looks down at everyone;
\q1 he looks to see if anyone is very wise,
\q2 wise enough to desire to know him.
\q1

Everyone turns away from Yahweh. They are depraved and do disgusting, filthy things. 
\q2 No one does what is good.
\b
\q1

Will those evil people never learn what God will do to punish them?
\q1 They act violently toward Yahweh's people and want to consume them like one who eats food consumes it,
\q2 and they never pray to Yahweh.
\q1

But some day they will become very terrified
\q2 because God helps those who act righteously and will punish those who reject him.
\q1

Those who do evil may prevent helpless people from doing what they plan to do,
\q2 but Yahweh protects them.
\b
\q1

Is there anyone for Yahweh to send to help the Israelite people on behalf of Yahweh?
\q2 Yahweh, when you bless your people again,
\q2 all of us Israelite people, who are the descendants of Jacob, will rejoice.

Yahweh, who are allowed to enter your sacred tent?
\q2 Who are allowed to live on your sacred mountain?
\q1

Only those who always do what is right and do not sin may do that,
\q2 those who always speak the truth.
\q2

They do not slander others.
\q1 They do not do to others things that are wrong,
\q2 and they do not say bad things about anyone.
\q1

People who honor God hate those whom he has rejected,
\q2 but they respect those who have a fearful respect for Yahweh.
\q1 They do what they have promised to do
\q2 even if it causes them trouble to do that.
\q1

They lend money to others without charging interest,
\q2 and they never accept bribes in order to lie about people who have not done anything wrong.
\b
\q1 Those who do those things will always live in safety.

\d A psalm written by David
\b
\q1

God, protect me
\q because I go to you to keep me safe!
\b
\q1

Those who choose to worship other gods will have many things that cause them to be sad.
\q I will not join them when they make sacrifices to their gods;
\q1 I will not even join them in speaking the names of their gods.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you are the one whom I have chosen,
\q and you give me great blessings.
\q1 You protect me and control what happens to me.
\q1

Yahweh has given me a wonderful place in which to live;
\q I am delighted with all the things that he has given me.
\b
\q1

I know that Yahweh is always with me.
\q Nothing will take me from his side.
\b
\q1

Therefore I am glad; I am honored to praise him,
\q and I can rest securely
\q1

because you, Yahweh, will not allow me to remain in the place where the dead people are,
\q and you will not allow me, someone who has been faithful to the covenant, to stay there.
\q1

You will show me the road that leads to where I receive eternal life,
\q and you will make me joyful when I am with you.
\q I will have pleasure forever when I am at your right hand.

\d A psalm written by David
\b
\q1

Yahweh, listen to me while I plead with you to act justly toward me.
\q2 Hear me while I call out to you to help me.
\q1 Pay attention to what I say while I pray
\q2 because I am speaking honestly.
\q1

You are the one who is able to declare that I am innocent;
\q2 please agree to do what is right for me.
\b
\q1

If you come to me at night to learn what I think,
\q2 if you see what I think in my heart,
\q1 you will know that I have determined to never tell any lies; you will find that I do not think evil things.
\q1

I have always done what you told me to do;
\q2 I have never failed to do those things.
\b
\q1

Continue to show me your love as you promised you would do.
\q2 By your great power you protect all who trust in you; you keep them safe from their enemies.
\q1

Do not allow wicked people to attack me,
\q2 those enemies of mine who surround, wanting to kill me.
\b
\q1

They are proud of their riches and success,
\q2 but they have no mercy on anyone.
\q1

They have hunted for me and found me.
\q2 They surround me, watching for an opportunity to throw me to the ground and kill me.
\q1

They are like lions that are ready to tear apart the animals that they capture;
\q2 They are like young lions that are hiding, waiting to jump on their prey.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, arise, attack my enemies, and defeat them!
\q2 With your sword save me from those wicked people!
\q1

Yahweh, by your power rescue me from those people who are interested only in things here in this world. 
\b
\q1 But you provide plenty of food for those whom you love dearly;
\q2 their children also have many things that their grandchildren will inherit.
\q1

Yahweh, because I act in the right way, I will be with you one day.
\q2 When I awake after I die, I will see you face to face, and then I will be happy.

\d A psalm written by God's servant David. He sang it after Yahweh had rescued him from Saul and his other enemies.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I love you, the one who enables me to be strong.
\b
\q1

Yahweh is like a huge rock; when I am on top of it, my enemies cannot reach me. He is like a strong fortress; I run into it to be safe.
\q1 He protects me like a shield protects a soldier; he is the one whom I trust to keep me safe; he defends me by his great power!
\q1

I called out to Yahweh, who deserves for me to praise him, and he rescued me from my enemies.
\b
\q1

All around me were dangerous situations in which I might die; it was as though there were huge waves that almost crashed on me and killed me.
\q1

It was as though the place where dead people are had ropes that were wrapped around me, or it was as though there was a trap that would seize and kill me.
\q1

But when I was very distressed, I called out to Yahweh, and far off in his temple he heard me.
\q1 He listened to me when I cried out for help.
\q1

Then Yahweh became angry, and the earth quaked, and the mountains shook to their very foundations!
\q1

He was so angry that it was as though smoke poured out from his nostrils, as though burning coals came out of his mouth!
\q1

He opened the sky and came down with a black cloud under his feet.
\q1

He flew, riding on the back of an angel traveling fast, which the wind was blowing along.
\q1

Darkness was all around him like a blanket; dark clouds, full of water moisture, covered him.
\q1

Hailstones and flashes of lightning were around him; hail and burning coals fell down from the sky.
\q1

Then Yahweh shouted loudly from the sky, and to his enemies, it sounded like thunder. Yahweh, the Supreme God, rained hailstones on them and caused lightning to flash against them.
\q1

He shot his arrows at them and caused them to scatter; his flashes of lightning caused them to become very confused.
\q1

The bottom of the ocean became visible, and the water uncovered the foundations of the earth when Yahweh rebuked his enemies 
\q with the breath that came in his anger!
\b
\q1

It was as though he reached down from heaven and grabbed me and pulled me up out of the deep ocean.
\q1

He rescued me from my strong enemies who hated me; they were very strong, and I could not defeat them by myself.
\q1

When I was distressed, they attacked me, but Yahweh defended me.
\q1

He made me completely safe; he rescued me because he was pleased with me.
\b
\q1

Yahweh has rewarded me because I do what is right; he has blessed me because I am innocent.
\q1

I have followed his decrees; I have not stopped obeying them.
\q1

He knows that I have not done what is wrong and that I have kept myself from sinning.
\q1

So he rewards me because I do what is right; he knows that I have not committed sins.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you are faithful to those who faithfully do your covenant; you always do what is good to those who do not do evil.
\q1

You are kind to those who are honest toward others, but you act wisely toward those who act dishonestly.
\q1

You save those who are humble, but you humiliate those who are proud.
\q1

You keep me alive, and you will continue to do so.
\q1

You enable me to be strong, so that I can attack and defeat a line of enemy soldiers; with your help I can scale the walls that surround my enemies' cities.
\b
\q1

Everything that Yahweh my God does is perfect. We can depend on him to do what he promises. 
\q He is like a shield to protect all those who go to him to be safe.
\q1

Yahweh is the only one who is God; only he is like a huge rock on top of which we can be safe.
\q1

God is the one who enables me to be strong and who keeps me safe on the roads that I walk on.
\q1

He enables me to walk swiftly without stumbling as a deer walks in the mountains.
\q1

He teaches me how to use a strong bow in order that I can use it to fight in battles.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you protect and save me with your shield; you are strong and have therefore kept me safe. I have become strong because you have helped me.
\q1

You have made a safe path for me, with the result that now I do not slip.
\b
\q1

I pursued my enemies and caught them; I did not stop until I had defeated them all.
\q1

When I strike them, they are not able to get up again; they lie on the ground, defeated.
\q1

You have enabled me to be strong in order that I can fight battles and defeat my enemies.
\q1

You delivered my enemies to me, for me to strike them on their necks. I have gotten rid of all those who hated me.
\q1

They shouted for someone to help them, but no one saved them. They shouted out to Yahweh, but he did not help them.
\q1

I crushed them to powder, and they became like the dust that the wind blows away; I threw them out like people throw dirt out into the streets.
\b
\q1

You enabled me to defeat those who fought against me and appointed me to be the ruler of many nations; people whom I did not know about previously are now slaves in my kingdom.
\q1

When foreigners hear about me, they cringe and they obey me.
\q1

They are no longer courageous, and from their holes where they were hiding they come to me trembling.
\b
\q1

Yahweh is alive! Praise the one who is like a huge rock on top of which I am safe! Exalt the God who saves me!
\q1

He enables me to get revenge on my enemies; he causes me to defeat nations and to rule over them,
\q1

and he rescues me from my enemies. He has lifted me up high so that violent men could not reach me and harm me.
\q1

So I praise him, and I tell the nations the great things that he has done.
\q1

He has enabled me, his king, to powerfully defeat my enemies; he faithfully loves me as he promised in his covenant. 
\q He loves me, David, the one he has chosen to be king, and he will faithfully love my descendants forever.

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director
\b
\q

Day after day it is as though the sun proclaims the glory of God,
\q2 and night after night it is as though the moon and stars say that they know that God made them.
\q1

They do not really speak;
\q2 they do not say any words.
\q2 There is no sound from them for anyone to hear.
\q1

But what they declare about God goes throughout the world,
\q2 and even people who live in the most distant places on earth can know it.
\b
\q1 The sun is in the skies where God placed it;
\q1

it rises each morning like a bridegroom who is happy as he comes out of his bedroom after his wedding.
\q2 It is like a strong athlete who is very eager to start running in a race.
\q1

The sun rises at one side of the sky and goes across the sky and sets on the other side;
\q2 nothing can hide from its heat.
\b
\q1

The instructions that Yahweh has given us are perfect;
\q2 they revive us.
\q2 We can be sure that the things that Yahweh has told us will never change,
\q2 and by learning them people who have not been previously taught will become wise.
\b
\q1

Yahweh's laws are fair;
\q2 when we obey them, we become joyful.
\q1 The commands of Yahweh are clear,
\q2 and by reading them we start to understand how God wants us to behave.
\q1

It is good for people to revere Yahweh;
\q2 that is something that they will do forever.
\q1 What Yahweh has decreed is fair,
\q2 and it is always right.
\q1

The things that God has decided are more valuable than gold,
\q2 even the finest gold.
\q1 They are sweeter than honey
\q2 that drips from honeycombs.
\q1

Furthermore, by reading them I learn what things are good to do and what things are evil,
\q1 and they promise a great reward
\q2 to us who obey them.
\b
\q1

Keep me from doing things that I know are wrong;
\q2 do not let me keep doing the evil things I want to do.
\q1 If you do that, I will no longer be guilty for committing such sins,
\q2 and I will not commit the great sin of rebelling terribly against you.
\q1

O Yahweh, you are like a huge rock on top of which I can be safe; you are the one who protects me.
\q2 I hope that the things that I say and what I think will always please you.

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director
\b
\q1

We desire that Yahweh may help you when you call out to him when you have troubles!
\q1 We desire that God, whom our ancestor Jacob honored, may keep you safe from your enemies.
\q1

We desire that he may reach out from his sacred temple and help you
\q2 and aid you from where he lives on Mount Zion.
\q1

We desire that he may accept all the offerings that you give him to be burned on the altar
\q2 and all your other offerings.
\q1

We desire that he may give to you what you desire in your heart,
\q2 and that you may be able to accomplish all that you desire to do.
\q1

When you defeat your enemies, we will shout joyfully.
\q2 We will lift up a banner proclaiming that it is God who has helped you.
\q1 May Yahweh do for you all that you request him to do.
\b
\q1

I know now that Yahweh rescues me, the one whom he has chosen to be king.
\q1 From his holy place in heaven he will answer me,
\q2 and he will save me by his great power.
\q1

Some kings trust that because they have chariots they will be able to defeat their enemies,
\q2 and some trust that their horses will enable them to defeat their enemies,
\q2 but we will trust in the power of Yahweh our God.
\q1

Some will stumble and fall down,
\q2 but we will be strong and not be moved.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, help the king defeat our enemies!
\q2 Answer us when we call out to you to help us!

Yahweh, the man you made king is glad because you have caused him to be strong.
\q2 He rejoices because you have enabled him to defeat his enemies.
\q1

You have given him everything he most desired,
\q2 and you have not refused to do what he requested you to do.
\q1

You have done so many wonderful things for him.
\q2 You placed a gold crown on his head.
\q1

He asked you to let him live for a long time,
\q2 and you have enabled him to live for a long time.
\q1

His power as king is very great because you have allowed him to win victories over his enemies.
\q1

You will bless him forever,
\q2 and you have caused him to be joyful in your presence.
\q1

Yahweh, you are God Almighty,
\q2 and the king trusts in you.
\q1 Because you faithfully love him,
\q2 disastrous things will never happen to him.
\b
\q1

You will enable him to kill all his enemies,
\q2 all those who hate him.
\q1

When you appear, you will throw them into a fiery furnace.
\q1 Because you are angry with them, you will swallow them up;
\q2 the fire will burn them up.
\q1

They wanted to harm you,
\q2 but what they plan will never succeed.
\q1

You will cause them to run away
\q2 by shooting arrows at them.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, show us that you are very strong!
\q2 When you do that, we will sing and praise you because you are very powerful.

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director, to be sung to the tune 'Doe of the Dawn'
\b
\q1

My God, my God, why have you abandoned me?
\q2 Why do you stay so far from me,
\q2 and why do you not listent to me?
\q1 Why do you not hear me when I am suffering and groaning?
\q1

My God, every day I call to you during the daytime, but you do not answer me.
\q2 I call to you during the night; I am not silent at all.
\b
\q1

But you are holy.
\q2 You sit on your throne as king, and we the people of Israel praise you.
\q1

Our ancestors trusted in you.
\q1 Because they trusted in you, you rescued them.
\q1

When they called out to you for help, you saved them.
\q2 They trusted in you, and they were not disappointed.
\b
\q1

But you have not rescued me!
\q2 People despise me and consider that I am not a man;
\q2 they think that I am a worm!
\q1 Everyone scorns me and despises me.
\q1

Everyone who sees me makes fun of me.
\q2 They sneer at me and insult me by shaking their heads at me as though I were an evil man.
\q1 They say,
\q1

"He trusts in Yahweh,
\q2 so Yahweh should save him!
\q1 He says that Yahweh is very pleased with him;
\q2 if that is so, Yahweh should rescue him!"
\q1

You, God, have been with me since I was in my mother's womb,
\q2 and you taught me to trust you when I was at my mother's breasts.
\q1

It was as though you had adopted me right when I was born.
\q2 You have been my God ever since I was born.
\q1

So do not stay far from me now
\q2 because enemies who will cause me much trouble are near me,
\q2 and there is no one else who can help me.
\b
\q1

My enemies surround me like a herd of wild bulls.
\q2 Fierce people, like those strong bulls that graze on the hills in the region of Bashan, surround me.
\q1

I am completely exhausted,
\q2 and all my bones are out of their joints.
\q1 I no longer expect that God will save me;
\q2 I am completely discouraged.
\q1

My strength is all dried up 
\q2 like a broken piece of a clay jar that has dried in the sun.
\q2 I am so thirsty that my tongue sticks to the roof of my mouth.
\q2 God, I think that you are about to let my body die and become dust!
\q1

My enemies are like wild dogs that surround me.
\q2 A group of evil men has encircled me, ready to attack me.
\q2 They have pierced through my hands and my feet.
\q1

I am so weak and thin that I can count all my bones.
\q2 My enemies stare at me and gloat about what has happened to me.
\q1

They looked at the clothes that I was wearing
\q2 and gambled to determine which piece each of them would get.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, be concerned for me!
\q2 You who are my source of strength,
\q1 come quickly and help me!
\q1

Rescue me from those who want to kill me with their swords.
\q2 Save my life from the power of those who are like wild dogs.
\q1

Snatch me away from my enemies who are like lions with jaws open and ready to chew me up!
\q2 Grab me away from those men who are like wild oxen that attack other animals with their horns!
\b
\q1

If you save me from them, I will declare to my fellow Israelites how great you are.
\q2 I will praise you among the group of your people gathered together to worship you.
\q1

You people who have an awesome respect for Yahweh, praise him!
\q2 All you who are descended from Jacob, honor Yahweh!
\q2 All you Israelite people, revere him!
\q1

He does not despise or ignore those who are suffering;
\q2 he does not hide his face from them.
\q1 He has listened to them when they cried out to him for help.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, in the great gathering of your people, I will praise you for what you have done.
\q2 In the presence of those who have an awesome respect for you, I will offer the sacrifices that I promised.
\q1

The poor people whom I have invited to the meal will eat as much as they want.
\q2 All who come to worship Yahweh will praise him.
\q2 I pray that God will enable you all to live a long and happy life!
\q1

I pray that people in all nations, even in the remote areas, will think about Yahweh and turn to him,
\q2 and that people from all the clans in the world will bow down before him.
\q1

For Yahweh is the king!
\q2 He rules all the nations.
\b
\q1

All the rich people on the earth will celebrate and bow before him.
\q2 Some day they will die, for they cannot avoid it,
\q2 but they will prostrate themselves on the ground in his presence.
\q1

People in the future generations will also serve Yahweh.
\q2 They will tell their children about what Yahweh has done.
\q1

People who are not yet born, who will live in future years, will learn how Yahweh rescued his people.
\q2 People will tell them, "Yahweh did it!"

Yahweh, you care for me like a shepherd cares for his sheep,
\q2 so I have everything that I need.
\q1

You enable me to rest in peace
\q1 as when a shepherd leads his sheep to places where there is plenty of green grass for them to eat,
\q2 as when he lets them lie down beside streams where the water is flowing slowly.
\q1

You renew my strength.
\q1 You show me how to live in the right way,
\q2 in order that I can honor you.
\b
\q1

Even when I am walking in very dangerous places 
\q2 where I might die,
\q1 I will not be afraid of anything
\q2 because you are with me.
\q1 You protect me like a shepherd protects his sheep.
\b
\q1

You prepare a great feast for me
\q2 in a place where my enemies can see me.
\q1 You welcome me
\q2 as a guest whom you honor.
\q1 You have given me very many blessings!
\q1

I am certain that you will be good to me
\q1 and act mercifully toward me
\q2 as long as I live;
\q1 then, O Yahweh, I will live in your home forever.

\d A psalm written by David
\b
\q1

he built the land on the water,
\q2 above the water that is deep below.
\b
\q1

Who will be allowed to go up onto Mount Zion in Jerusalem,
\q2 in order to stand and worship in Yahweh's holy temple?
\q1

Only those whose actions and thoughts are pure,
\q2 who have not worshiped idols,
\q2 and who do not tell lies when they have solemnly promised to tell the truth.
\q1

Yahweh will bless them.
\q1 When God judges them, he will rescue them and say that they have done nothing wrong.
\q1

They are the people who come to God,
\q2 they are the ones who desire to worship God, 
\q2 and serve the God of Jacob.
\b
\q1

Open up the temple gates
\q2 in order that our glorious king may enter!
\q1

Do you know who the glorious king is?
\q2 It is Yahweh, the one who is very strong;
\q2 It is Yahweh, who conquers all his enemies in battles!
\q1

Open up the temple gates
\q2 in order that our glorious king may enter!
\q1

\d A psalm written by David
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I give myself to you.
\q1

My God, I trust in you.
\q1 Do not allow my enemies to defeat me
\q2 and shame me.
\q1 Do not allow my enemies to defeat me
\q2 and rejoice over me.
\q1

Do not allow any of those who trust in you to be ashamed.
\q2 Cause those who act treacherously toward others to be disgraced.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, show me the way that I should conduct my life,
\q2 teach me how to act in the manner that you want me to act.
\q1

Teach me to conduct my life by obeying your truth
\q2 because you are my God, the one who saves me.
\q2 All during the day I trust in you.
\q1

Forgive me for all the sinful things I did and the ways that I rebelled against you when I was young;
\q2 I request this because you faithfully love your people and do good things for them, as you promised in your covenant.
\q1 Yahweh, do not forget me!
\b
\q1

Yahweh is good and fair,
\q2 so he shows sinners how they should conduct their lives.
\q1

He shows humble people what is right for them to do
\q2 and teaches them what he wants them to do.
\q1

He always faithfully loves us and does what he has promised
\q2 for those who obey his covenant and who do what he requires.
\q1

Yahweh, forgive me for all my sins, which are many,
\q2 in order that I may honor you.
\b
\q1

To all those who have an awesome respect for you,
\q2 you show them the right way to conduct their lives.
\q1

They will always be prosperous,
\q2 and their descendants will continue to live in this land.
\q1

Yahweh is a friend of those who have an awesome respect for him,
\q2 and he teaches them the covenant that he made with them.
\q1

I always request Yahweh to help me,
\q2 and he rescues me from danger.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, pay attention to me and be merciful to me because I am alone,
\q2 and I am greatly distressed because I am suffering.
\q1

Note that I am distressed and troubled,
\q2 and forgive me for all my sins.
\q1

Protect me because I do what is good and honest
\q2 and because I trust in you.
\b
\q1
God, rescue us Israelite people from all of our troubles!

Yahweh, show that I am innocent.
\q1 I always do what is right;
\q2 I have trusted in you and never doubted that you would help me.
\q1

I do not spend my time with liars,
\q2 and I stay away from hypocrites.
\q1

I do not like to be with evil people,
\q2 and I avoid wicked people.
\q1

Yahweh, I wash my hands to show that I am innocent.
\q1 As I join with others marching around your altar,
\q1

we sing songs to thank you,
\q2 and we tell others the wonderful things that you have done.
\q1

Yahweh, I love to be in the house where you live,
\q2 in the place where your glory appears.
\b
\q1

people who are ready to do wicked things
\q2 and those who are always taking bribes.
\q1

But as for me, I always try to do what is right.
\q2 So act kindly toward me and rescue me.
\b
\q1

I stand in places where I am safe,
\q2 and when all your people gather together, I praise you.

\d A psalm written by David
\b
\q1

Yahweh is the one who gives me life and the one who saves me,
\q2 so I do not need to be afraid of anyone.
\q1 Yahweh is the one to whom I go for refuge,
\q2 so I will never be afraid.
\q1

When those who do evil come near me to destroy me,
\q2 they stumble and fall down.
\q1

Even if an army surrounds me,
\q2 I will not be afraid.
\q1 Even if they attack me,
\q2 I will trust in God.
\b
\q1

There is one thing that I have requested from Yahweh;
\q2 this is the one thing that I desire:
\q1 that I may worship in Yahweh's house every day during my life,
\q2 that I may see how wonderful Yahweh is, 
\q2 and that I may ask him what he wants me to do.
\b
\q1

He will protect me when I have troubles;
\q2 he will keep me safe in his sacred tent.
\q1 He will set me safely on a high rock.
\q1

Then I will triumph over my enemies.
\q1 I will shout joyfully as I offer sacrifices in his sacred tent,
\q2 and I will praise Yahweh as I sing.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, listen to me while I call to you.
\q2 Act kindly toward me and answer my prayer.
\q1

Within my inner being I desire to worship you,
\q2 so, Yahweh, I will come to your temple to pray to you.
\q1

I am your servant;
\q2 do not be angry with me, or turn away from me.
\q2 You have always helped me.
\q1 You are the one who has saved me,
\q2 so do not abandon me now.
\q1

Even if my father and mother desert me,
\q2 Yahweh always takes care of me.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, teach me to do what you want me to do,
\q1 and lead me on a safe path
\q2 because I have many enemies.
\q1

Do not allow my enemies to do to me what they want;
\q2 they say many false things about me and threaten to do violent things to me.
\b
\q1

I would have died if I had not trusted you
\q2 to be good to me as long as I live.
\q1

So trust in Yahweh!
\q2 Be strong and courageous,
\q2 and wait expectantly for him to help you!

\d A psalm written by David
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I call out to you;
\q1 You are like a huge rock on top of which I am safe.
\q1 Do not refuse to answer me
\q2 because if you are silent, I will soon be with those who are in their graves.
\q1

Listen to me when I call out for you to help me,
\q2 when I lift up my hands as I face your very holy place in your sacred tent.
\b
\q1

Do not drag me away with wicked people,
\q2 with those who do wicked deeds,
\q1 with those who pretend to act peacefully toward others
\q2 while in their inner beings, they hate them.
\q1

Yahweh, they do not pay attention to the wonderful things that you have done and that you have created;
\q2 so get rid of them permanently and do not let them appear again!
\b
\q1

Praise Yahweh
\q2 because he has heard me when I called out for him to help me!
\q1

Yahweh makes me strong and protects me like a shield;
\q2 I trust in him, and he helps me.
\q1 So I was glad in my inner being,
\q2 and from my inner being I praise him as I sing to him.
\b
\q1

Mighty people, praise Yahweh!
\q2 Praise him because he is very glorious and powerful.
\q1

Proclaim that he is glorious;
\q2 dress in your best clothing and bow down to Yahweh.
\b
\q1

Yahweh's voice is heard above the oceans;
\q2 the glorious God thunders.
\q1 He appears over the huge oceans.
\q1

His voice is powerful and majestic.
\q1

Yahweh's voice breaks great cedar trees,
\q2 the cedars that grow in Lebanon.
\q1

Yahweh's voice tells the lightning to flash.
\q1

Yahweh's voice makes the large trees shake,
\q2 and strips the leaves from the trees
\q2 while the people in the temple shout, "Praise God!"
\b
\q1

Yahweh enables his people to be strong,
\q2 and he blesses them by causing things to go well for them.

\d A psalm written by David for the dedication of the temple
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I praise you because you rescued me. You did not allow me to die or my enemies to gloat over me.
\q1

Yahweh, my God, I called out for you to help me when I was wounded, and you healed me.
\q1

You saved me from death. I was nearly dead, but you caused me to become healthy again.
\b
\q1

All you who are faithful to the covenant with Yahweh, sing to praise him! Remember what God, the holy one, has done and thank him!
\q1

When he becomes angry, he is angry for only a very short time, but he is good to us all of our lives.
\q1 We may cry during the night, but the next morning we will be joyful.
\b
\q1

As for me, I was calm when I said to myself, "No one will defeat me!"
\q1

Yahweh, because you were good to me, at first you caused me to be secure as though I were a high mountain.
\q1 But then I thought that you had turned away from me, and I became afraid.
\b
\q1

So I called out to you, and I pleaded for you to help me.
\q1

I said, "Yahweh, what will you gain if I die?
\q1 In what way will it benefit you if I go to the place where the dead people are?
\q1 When I am dead I will certainly not able to praise you, and I will not able to tell others that you are trustworthy!
\q1

Yahweh, listen to me, and act mercifully to me! Yahweh, help me!"
\b
\q1

But now you have healed me, and you have changed me from being sad to dancing joyfully.
\q1 You have taken away the clothes that showed that I was very sad and given me clothes that showed that I was very joyful.
\q1

So I will not be silent; I will sing out and praise you.
\q1 Yahweh, you are my God, and I will thank you forever.

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I have come to you to be protected;
\q2 do not allow me to be defeated and disgraced.
\q1 Since you always do what is fair,
\q2 rescue me!
\q1

Listen to me, and save me right now!
\q1 Be like a huge rock on which I can be safe 
\q2 and like a strong fort in which I will be secure.
\q1

You are the one who protects me,
\q2 so keep me from falling into the hidden traps that my enemies have set for me.
\q1

Yahweh, you are a God whom I can trust,
\q1 so I put myself into your care
\q2 because you will rescue me.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I hate those who worship useless idols,
\q2 but I trust in you.
\q1

I will be very glad because you faithfully love me.
\q1 You see me when I have been afflicted,
\q2 and you know when I have had troubles.
\q1

You have not allowed my enemies to capture me;
\q2 instead, you have rescued me from danger.
\b
\q1

But now, Yahweh, act kindly toward me
\q2 because I am distressed.
\q1 Because I cry so much, I cannot see well,
\q2 and I am completely exhausted.
\q1

All of my enemies make fun of me,
\q2 and even my neighbors despise me.
\q1 Even my friends are afraid of me because they think that you are punishing me.
\q2 When they see me on the streets, they run away.
\q1

People have forgotten me like they forget people who are dead.
\q2 They think I am as useless as a broken pot.
\q1

I have heard people slandering me,
\q2 and they have terrified me.
\q1 My enemies are making plans
\q2 to kill me.
\b
\q1

But Yahweh, I trust in you.
\q2 I say confidently that you are the God I worship.
\q1

My whole life is in your hands;
\q2 save me from my enemies,
\q2 from those who pursue me.
\q1

Act kindly toward me
\q2 and rescue me because you always faithfully love me.
\q1

Yahweh, I call out to you,
\q2 so do not allow others to disgrace me.
\q1 I wish that wicked people may be disgraced;
\q2 I wish that they may go down to the place where the people are silent and dead.
\q1

I wish that you may cause people who tell lies to be unable to speak.
\q2 Do that to people who are proud and to those who arrogantly accuse others.
\b
\q1

You have stored up many great and good things to do for those who have great respect for you.
\q2 You do good things for those who go to you to be protected;
\q2 everyone sees you doing that.
\q1

You hide people in your presence where it is safe,
\q2 and you protect them from others who plot to kill them.
\q1 You hide them in safe places where their enemies cannot speak evil at them.
\b
\q1

Praise Yahweh!
\q2 When my enemies surrounded the city in which I was living,
\q2 he showed me wonderfully that he faithfully loves me.
\q1

I was afraid and cried out in a hurry, "I have been separated from Yahweh!"
\q2 but you heard me and answered my cry for help.
\b
\q1

You people who belong to Yahweh, love him!
\q2 He protects those who are loyal to him,
\q2 but he punishes the proud; he punishes them severely as they deserve.
\q1

You who confidently expect Yahweh to do great things for you,
\q2 be strong and be courageous!

\d A psalm written by David, which will help people to be wise
\b
\q1

Those whom God has forgiven for rebelling against him
\q2 and those whose sin God does not look at,
\q2 these are the ones who are truly fortunate!
\q1

Those whose record of sins Yahweh has erased
\q2 and those who no longer do deceitful things,
\q2 these are the ones who are truly fortunate!
\b
\q1

When I did not confess my sins,
\q2 my body was very weak and sick,
\q2 and I groaned all day long.
\q1

Day and night, Yahweh, you punished me severely.
\q2 My strength disappeared like water that evaporates on a hot summer day.
\q1

Then I confessed my sins to you;
\q2 I stopped trying to hide them.
\q1 I said to myself,
\q2 "I will tell Yahweh the wrong things that I have done."
\q1 When I confessed them, you forgave me,
\q2 so now I am no longer guilty for my sins.
\b
\q1

Therefore the people who honor you should pray to you
\q2 when they are in great trouble.
\q1 If they do that, difficulties will not come on them like a great flood.
\q1

You are like a place where I can hide from my enemies;
\q2 you protect me from troubles
\q2 and enable me to shout, praising you for saving me from my enemies.
\b
\q1

Yahweh says to me, "I will instruct you about how you should conduct your life.
\q2 I will teach you and watch over you.
\q1

Do not be stupid like horses and mules that do not understand anything;
\q2 they need bits
\q2 so they will go in the direction you want them to go."
\q1

Wicked people will have many troubles that will make them sad,
\q2 but those who trust in Yahweh will experience him faithfully loving them all the time.
\b
\q1

So, all you righteous people, rejoice about what Yahweh has done for you;
\q2 you whose heart are pure, be glad and shout joyfully!

You righteous people should shout joyfully to Yahweh
\q2 because that is what he deserves.
\q1

Praise Yahweh as you play songs on the harp.
\q2 Praise him as you play harps that have ten strings.
\q1

Sing a new song to him;
\q2 play those instruments well, and shout joyfully as you play them.
\b
\q1

He loves everything that we do that is just and right.
\q2 Yahweh helps people all over the earth because he always loves them.
\b
\q1

Yahweh created everything in the sky by commanding it.
\q2 By what he commanded, he created all the stars.
\q1

He gathered all the water into one huge mass
\q2 like someone scoops liquid into a container.
\q1

When he spoke, he created the world.
\q2 Everything started to exist when he commanded it to be.
\q1

Yahweh stops the other nations from doing the things they want to do.
\q2 He prevents them from doing the evil things that they plan to do.
\q1

But what Yahweh decides to do will last forever.
\q2 What he plans to do will never change.
\b
\q1

Yahweh looks down from heaven and sees all people.
\q1

From where he rules, he looks down on all the people who live on the earth.
\q1

He forms our inner beings,
\q2 and he sees everything that we do.
\q1

It is not because a king has a great army that he is able to win battles,
\q2 and it is not because a soldier is very strong that he is able to defeat his enemy.
\q1

It is foolish to think that because horses are very strong,
\q2 they will be able to win a battle and save their riders.
\q1

Do not forget that Yahweh watches over those who honor him,
\q2 those who confidently expect him to faithfully love them.
\q1

He saves them from dying before they should die;
\q2 he preserves them when there is a famine.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, we pray that you will always faithfully love us
\q2 while we confidently expect you to do great things for us.

\d A psalm written by David when he pretended to be insane in front of King Abimelech so that the king would send him away
\b
\q1

I will praise Yahweh for what he has done.
\q2 All those who are oppressed should listen to me and rejoice.
\q1

Join with me in telling others that Yahweh is great!
\q2 You and I should together proclaim how glorious he is!
\b
\q1

I was miserable, but I called out to Yahweh, and he heard me.
\q2 He rescued me from all my troubles.
\q1

An angel from Yahweh guards those who have an awesome respect for him,
\q2 and the angel rescues them.
\q1

Try for yourself, and you will experience that Yahweh is good to you!
\q2 How fortunate are those who trust him to protect them.
\q1

All you who belong to him, have an awesome respect for him!
\q2 Those who do that will always have the things that they need.
\q1

Lions are usually very strong, but sometimes even young lions are hungry and become weak.
\q2 However, those who trust in Yahweh will have everything that they need.
\b
\q1

You who are my students, come and listen to me,
\q2 and I will teach you how to have an awesome respect for Yahweh.
\q1

If any of you wants to enjoy life
\q2 and have a good long life,
\q1

do not speak what it evil!
\q2 Do not tell lies!
\q1

Refuse to do evil; instead, do what is good!
\q2 Always try hard to enable people to live peacefully with each other!
\b
\q1

But Yahweh works against those who do what is evil.
\q2 After they die, people here on earth will forget them completely.
\b
\q1

Yahweh is always ready to help those who are discouraged;
\q2 he rescues those who have no hope for anything good.
\b
\q1

Righteous people may have many troubles,
\q2 but Yahweh rescues them from all those troubles.
\q1

Yahweh protects them from being harmed;
\q2 when their enemies attack them,
\q3 they will not break any bones of those righteous people.
\b
\q1

Disasters will kill the wicked people,
\q2 and Yahweh will punish those who oppose righteous people.
\q1

Yahweh will save those who serve him.
\q2 He will not condemn those who trust in him.

Yahweh, fight against those who fight against me!
\q2 Fight with my enemies when they fight me!
\q1

Be like a shield to protect me
\q2 and come to help me!
\q1

Lift up your spear and throw it at those who pursue me!
\q2 Promise me that you will enable me to defeat my enemies.
\b
\q1

Those who are trying to kill me—make others disgrace and dishonor them.
\q1 Push back and confuse those who are planning to do evil things to me.
\q1

Send your angel to pursue them
\q2 and to make them disappear like chaff that the wind blows away.
\q1

Cause the path on which they run to be dark and slippery
\q2 as your angel pursues them!
\q1

Although I did not do anything wrong to them,
\q2 they dug a deep pit for me to fall into;
\q2 they hid a net in which they would catch me.
\q1

Cause them to suddenly experience disaster!
\q2 Cause their own nets to trap them.
\q1 Cause them to fall into the pits that they have dug for me, and make them die in them!
\q1

With my whole inner being I will say,
\q2 "There is no one like Yahweh!
\q1 No one else can rescue helpless people from powerful people.
\q2 No one else can rescue weak and needy people from those who want to rob them."
\b
\q1

People who tell lies stand in court
\q2 and accuse me of doing things that I do not know anything about.
\q1

In return for my doing good things for them, they do evil things to me,
\q2 with the result that I feel that I am alone.
\q1

When they were ill, I showed that I was sad.
\q2 I did not eat any food, and I bowed my head as I prayed for them.
\q1

I mourned and bowed my head as I prayed
\q2 as though it were a friend or my mother for whom I was grieving.
\q1

But when I had troubles, they were all happy about it.
\q2 They unexpectedly gathered around to make fun of me.
\q1 Strangers kept striking me;
\q2 they would not stop.
\q1

People who respect no one ridiculed me
\q2 and snarled at me.
\q1

Lord, how long will you only watch them doing this?
\q2 Rescue me from their attacks;
\q1 Save me from being killed by these men who are attacking me
\q2 as lions attack other animals!
\q1

Then, when many of your people gather,
\q2 I will praise you,
\q1 and I will thank you in front of all of them.
\b
\q1

Do not allow my enemies, who tell lies about me, defeat me
\q2 and then rejoice about it!
\q1 Do not allow those who hate me when there in no reason to hate me
\q2 to laugh about how I suffer!
\q1

They shout at me in order to accuse me;
\q2 they say, "We saw the wrong things that you did!"
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you have seen these things, so do not be silent!
\q2 Do not stay far from me!
\q1

Arise, my God, plead my case in court,
\q2 and successfully defend me!
\q1

Yahweh, my God, because you are righteous,
\q1 prove that I am innocent
\q2 so that my enemies will not be able to gloat that I was judged to be guilty.
\q1

Do not allow them to be able to say to themselves,
\q2 "Yes, we have gotten rid of him just like we desired!"
\b
\q1

Cause those who rejoice about my misfortunes
\q2 to be completely confused and disgraced;
\q1 cause those who boast that they are much greater than I am
\q2 to be disgraced and dishonored!
\q1

But cause those who desire that you declare me innocent
\q2 to be happy and shout joyfully;
\q1 cause them to always say, "Yahweh is great!
\q2 He is delighted to cause things to go well for those who serve him."
\q1

Then I will proclaim that you act in the right way,
\q2 and I will praise you all the time.

\d A psalm written for the choir director by David, a man who served God faithfully
\b
\q1

A continual desire to sin is in the inner beings of wicked people.
\q1 They consider that they do not need to have an awesome respect for God.
\q1

Because they want to believe good things about themselves,
\q2 they do not think that God knows and hates their sins.
\q1

Everything that they say is deceitful and full of lies;
\q2 they no longer do what is good
\q2 and are no longer wise.
\q1

While they are lying on their beds, they plan to do things to harm others;
\q2 they are determined to do things that are not good,
\q2 and they never refuse to do what is evil.
\b
\q1

Your righteous behavior is as permanent as the highest mountains;
\q2 your acting justly will continue as long as the deepest oceans will continue.
\q1 You take care of people and you take care of animals.
\q1

God, your faithful love for us is very precious.
\q1 You protect us like birds protect their baby birds under their wings .
\q1

You are the one who causes everything to live;
\q2 your light is what enables us to know the truth about you.
\b
\q1

Continue to faithfully love those who are faithful to you,
\q2 and protect those who act righteously.
\q1

Do not allow proud people to attack me,
\q2 or allow wicked people to chase me away.
\q1

Look where evil people have fallen on the ground, defeated;
\q2 they were thrown down, and they will never rise again.

Do not be bothered by what wicked people do.
\q2 Do not desire to have the things that people who do wrong have
\q1

because they will soon disappear like grass withers in the hot sun and dries up.
\q2 Just like some green plants come up but die during the hot summer,
\q2 evil people will soon die also.
\b
\q1

Trust in Yahweh and do what is good.
\q2 If you do that, then you will live safely in the land he has given you,
\q2 and that land will be a place where you can be faithful to God as you live your lives.
\q1

Be delighted with all that Yahweh does for you;
\q2 if you do that, he will give you the things that you desire most.
\b
\q1

Commit to Yahweh all the things that you plan to do;
\q2 trust in him,
\q2 and he will do whatever is needed to help you.
\q1

He will show as clearly as the sunlight that you are innocent;
\q2 he will show as clearly as the sun at noontime 
\q2 that all the things that you have decided are just.
\b
\q1

Be quiet in Yahweh's presence and wait patiently for him to do what you want him to do.
\q2 Do not be bothered when what evil men do is successful,
\q2 when they are able to do the wicked things that they plan.
\q1

Do not be angry about what wicked people do.
\q2 Do not want to punish them yourself.
\q2 Do not be envious of such people
\q2 because you will only harm yourself if you try to do that.
\q1

Someday Yahweh will get rid of wicked people,
\q2 but those who trust in him will live safely in the land that he has given to them.
\b
\q1

Soon the wicked will disappear.
\q2 You will look for them, but they will be gone.
\q1

But those who are humble will live safely in their land.
\q2 They will happily enjoy living peacefully and having the other good things that Yahweh gives them.
\b
\q1

But Yahweh laughs at them
\q2 because he knows that someday he will judge and punish the wicked people.
\b
\q1

Wicked people pull out their swords
\q2 and they put strings on their bows,
\q1 ready to kill people who are poor 
\q2 and to slaughter those who live righteously.
\q1

But they will be killed by their own swords,
\q2 and their bows will be broken.
\b
\q1

It is good to be righteous even if you do not have many possessions,
\q2 but it is bad to be wicked even if you are very wealthy
\q1

because Yahweh will completely remove the strength of wicked people,
\q2 but he will sustain people who live righteously.
\b
\q1

They will survive when calamities occur;
\q2 when there are famines, they will still have plenty to eat.
\b
\q1

But wicked people will die;
\q2 just as the beautiful wild flowers in the fields die under the hot sun and disappear like smoke,
\q2 Yahweh will cause his enemies to suddenly disappear.
\b
\q1

Those whom Yahweh has blessed will live safely in the land that he has given to them,
\q2 but he will get rid of those people whom he has cursed.
\b
\q1

even if they stumble, they will not fall down
\q2 because Yahweh holds them by his hand.
\b
\q1

I was young previously, and now I am an old man,
\q2 but in all those years, I have never seen that righteous people have been abandoned by Yahweh,
\q2 nor have I seen that their children needed to beg for food.
\q1

Righteous people are generous and happily lend money to others,
\q2 and their children are a blessing to them.
\b
\q1

Turn away from doing evil, and do what is good.
\q2 If you do that, you and your descendants will live in your land forever.
\q1

This will happen because Yahweh likes to see people doing what is just,
\q2 and he will never forsake righteous people.
\b
\q1 He will protect them forever;
\q2 but he will get rid of the children of wicked people.
\q1

Righteous people will own the land that Yahweh promised to give to them,
\q2 and they will live there forever.
\b
\q1

Righteous people give wise advice to others,
\q2 and they encourage other people to live rightly.
\q1

They fill their minds with God's laws;
\q2 they do not stray from walking on God's path.
\b
\q1

Those who are evil wait in ambush for righteous people
\q2 in order to kill them as they walk by.
\q1

But Yahweh will not abandon righteous people
\q2 and let them fall into their enemies' hands.
\q1 He will not allow righteous people to be condemned
\q2 when someone takes them to a judge to be put on trial.
\b
\q1

Be patient and trust that Yahweh will help you,
\q2 and walk on his paths.
\q1 If you do that, he will honor you by giving you the land that he promised,
\q2 and when he gets rid of the wicked, you will see it happen.
\q1

I have seen that wicked people who act like tyrants sometimes prosper like trees that grow well in fertile soil,
\q1

but when I looked later, they were gone!
\q2 I searched for them, but Yahweh had caused them to disappear.
\b
\q1

But Yahweh will get rid of the wicked;
\q2 he will also get rid of their descendants.
\b
\q1

\d A psalm written by David, asking God not to forget him
\b
\q1

Yahweh, when you are angry with me,
\q2 do not rebuke me and punish me!
\q1

Because you have been angry with me,
\q2 I am suffering great pain.
\q1 Because of my sin,
\q2 my whole body is diseased.
\q1

All my sins are like a flood that covers my head;
\q2 they are like a load that is very heavy; I cannot carry them.
\b
\q1

Because I have done foolish things,
\q2 I have sores that have become worse, and they stink.
\q1

My body is burning with fever,
\q2 and I am very ill.
\q1

I am completely exhausted, and I have no strength.
\q2 I am very distressed in my inner being, and I groan with pain.
\b
\q1

My heart pounds heavily, and all my strength is gone.
\q2 I am no longer able to see well.
\q1

Now I act like a deaf man and do not listen to what they say.
\q2 I act like a man who cannot talk, and I say nothing to reply to them.
\q1

I act like a man who does not answer when people talk to him
\q2 because he cannot hear anything.
\q1

But Yahweh, I trust in you.
\q2 My Lord God, you will answer me.
\q1

I said to you, "Do not cause me to die so that my enemies will rejoice!
\q2 If troubles overwhelm me, my enemies will do very bad things to me!"
\b
\q1

I say that because I am about to fall down,
\q2 and I constantly have pain.
\q1

Those who do evil things to me in return for my doing good things to them
\q2 oppose me because I try to do what is right.
\b
\q1

Lord, you are the one who saves me;
\q2 Quickly come and help me!

\d A psalm written by David for Jeduthun, the choir director
\b
\q1

I said to myself, "I will be careful not to sin by the things that I say.
\q1 I will not say anything to complain to you
\q2 while wicked people are near to me and can hear me."
\q1

I became very anxious in my inner being.
\q2 As I thought about my troubles, I became more worried.
\q2 Then finally I said this:
\b
\q1

"Yahweh, show me how long I will live.
\q2 Tell me when I will die.
\q2 Tell me how many years I will live!
\q1

It seems that you have caused me to live only a short time;
\q2 my lifetime seems nothing to you.
\q2 The time that all we humans live is as short as a puff of air.
\q1

Then we disappear like a shadow does.
\q2 It seems that all that we do is for nothing.
\q2 We sometimes get a lot of money, but we do not even know who will get it after we die.
\q1

So now, Yahweh, I can expect to receive nothing from anyone else.
\q2 You are the only one from whom I confidently expect to receive blessings.
\q1

Save me from being punished for all the sins that I have committed.
\q2 Do not allow foolish people to make fun of me.
\q1

I did not say anything when you punished me
\q2 because I knew that you were the one who caused me to suffer.
\q1

But now, please stop punishing me!
\q2 If you do not do that, I am about to die because of how you make me suffer.
\q1

When you rebuke someone and punish him for the sin that he has committed,
\q2 you destroy the things that he loves like moths eat away at clothing.
\q2 Our lives disappear like a puff of air.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, listen to me while I pray;
\q2 pay attention to me while I cry out to you.
\q2 Help me while I am crying.
\q1 I am here on the earth for only a short time,
\q2 like all my ancestors.
\q1

Now please allow me to be alone and do not punish me anymore
\q2 so that I may smile and be happy for a while before I die."

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director
\b
\q1

I waited patiently for Yahweh to help me,
\q2 and he listened to me when I called out to him.
\q1

When I had many troubles, it was as though I was in a deep pit.
\q2 But he lifted me up out of the mud and slime of that pit;
\q1 he set my feet on a solid rock
\q2 and enabled me to walk safely.
\q1

He has given me a new song to sing,
\q2 a song to praise him who is our God.
\q1 Many people will find out what he has done for me,
\q2 and they will revere and trust him.
\b
\q1

How fortunate are those who trust Yahweh to protect them,
\q2 those who do not trust in idols
\q2 or join with those who worship those false gods.
\q1

O Yahweh, my God, you have done many wonderful things!
\q2 No one can list all the wonderful things that you have planned for us.
\q1 If I tried to tell others about all those wonderful things,
\q1 I would not be able to
\q2 because there would be too many for me to mention.
\b
\q1

Sacrifices and other offerings are not the things that delight you most.
\q2 But you have enabled me to hear your commands.
\q1 Animals burned on the altar and other offerings for our sins are not what you require most.
\q1

So I said to you, "Yahweh, here I am,
\q2 to obey the laws that have been written in the scroll,
\q2 things that you want me to do."
\q1

O my God, I enjoy doing what you desire;
\q2 I am always thinking about your laws within my inner being.
\b
\q1

When all your people were gathered together,
\q2 I told them about how you do what is right and how you rescue us.
\q2 Yahweh, you know that I have not refused to tell that to them.
\q1

I have not kept within me the news that you always act justly;
\q2 when many of your people have gathered together to worship you,
\q1 I have told them that you are faithful to us and save us.
\q2 I have not concealed that you faithfully love us and act loyally toward us.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, do not stop acting mercifully toward me.
\q2 Because you faithfully love me and are loyal to me, protect me always.
\q1

I have many troubles; I cannot count them.
\q2 I am now suffering the things that happened because I sinned.
\q2 I can no longer see because of my tears.
\q1 The sins that I have committed are more than the hairs on my head.
\q2 I am very discouraged.
\b
\q1

O Yahweh, please save me!
\q2 Come quickly to help me!
\q1

Humble those who are happy about my troubles, and cause them to be disgraced.
\q2 Chase away those who are trying to get rid of me.
\q1

I hope that those who make fun of me
\q2 will be dismayed when you defeat them.
\q1

But I hope that all those who go to worship you will be very joyful.
\q2 I hope that those who love you because you saved them will shout repeatedly,
\q1 "Yahweh is great!"
\b
\q1

As for me, I am poor and needy,
\q2 but I know that the Lord has not forgotten me.
\q1 O my God, you are the one who saves and helps me,
\q2 so please come quickly and help me!

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director
\b
\q1

Yahweh will protect them and allow them to live for a long time.
\q2 He will enable them to be happy in the land of Israel
\q2 and will rescue them from their enemies.
\q1

When they are sick, Yahweh will strengthen them
\q2 and will heal them.
\b
\q1

When my enemies come to me, they pretend to be concerned about me.
\q2 They eagerly listen to all the bad news about me.
\q2 Then they go away and tell everyone what is happening to me.
\b
\q1

All those who hate me whisper to others about me,
\q2 and they hope that very bad things will happen to me.
\q1

Even a very close friend, whom I trusted very much,
\q2 who often ate with me,
\q2 has betrayed me.
\b
\q1

But Yahweh, act mercifully to me, and enable me to become healthy again.
\q2 When you do that, I will be able to pay back my enemies.
\q1

If you enable me to do that, with the result that my enemies do not defeat me,
\q2 I will know that you are pleased with me.
\q1

I will know that it is because I have done what is right that you have helped me,
\q2 and I will know that you will enable me to be with you forever.
\b
\q1

Praise Yahweh, the God whom we Israelites worship;
\q2 Praise him forever!
\q2 Amen! I desire that it will be so!
\ms Book Two

\d A psalm written by one of the descendants of Korah for the choir director
\b
\q1

O God, I need you very much as a deer needs to drink water from a cool stream.
\q1

I desire to be with you, the all-powerful God.
\q2 I say to myself, "When will I be able to go back to the temple in Israel
\q2 and worship in your presence again?"
\q1

I pray earnestly to God as I remember
\q2 when I used to go with the crowd of people to the temple in Jerusalem.
\q2 I used to lead them as we walked along;
\q1 we were all shouting joyfully and singing to thank God for what he had done;
\q2 we were a large group who were celebrating.
\b
\q1

So now I say to myself, "Why am I in a panic?
\q1 I confidently expect God to bless me,
\q2 and again I will praise him,
\q2 my God, the one who saves me."
\b
\q1

But now, Yahweh, I was panicking,
\q2 so I think about you.
\q1 You are there in Israel where the Jordan River rushes down from the bottom of the peaks of Mount Hermon and from Mount Mizar.
\q1

But here, the great sorrow that I feel is like water that you send down;
\q2 it is like a waterfall that tumbles down and floods over me.
\b
\q1

I desire that Yahweh will show me each day that he faithfully loves me,
\q2 in order that each night I may sing to him
\q2 and pray to him, the God who causes me to live.
\b
\q1

I say to God, who is like a huge rock on top of which I am safe,
\q1 "Why have you forgotten me? You know the hardships that my enemies bring on me."
\q1

They are always making fun of me;
\q2 they keep asking, "Why does your God not help you?" 
\q1 When they insult me like that,
\q2 it is like wounds that shatter my bones.
\b
\q1

But I say to myself,
\q2 "Why am I in a panic?
\q1 I will confidently expect God to bless me,
\q2 and I will praise him again,
\q2 my God, the one who saves me."

God, declare that I am innocent.
\q1 Defend me when people say things against me—those people who do not honor you!
\q2 Rescue me from people who deceive me and say things about me that are not true.
\q1

You are God, the one who protects me;
\q2 why have you abandoned me?
\q1 It does not seem right that I should always have to be sad
\q2 because of my enemies acting cruelly toward me.
\q1

Speak true words that help me to live. 
\q1 Give a command that will allow me to go back to Zion, your sacred hill in Jerusalem,
\q1 and to your temple where you live.
\q1

When you do that, I will go to your altar
\q2 to worship you, my God, who causes me to be very joyful.
\q2 There I will praise you, the God whom I worship, and I will play my harp.
\b
\q1

So why am I sad and discouraged?
\q1 I confidently expect God to bless me,
\q2 and again I will praise him,
\q2 my God, the one who saves me.

\d A psalm written by one of the descendants of Korah for the choir director.
\b
\q1

God, we ourselves have heard
\q2 what our parents and grandparents told us.
\q1 They told us about the miracles
\q2 that you performed long ago.
\q1

They told us how you expelled the ungodly people
\q2 and enabled us to live in their land.
\q1 They told us that you punished those ungodly people
\q2 and enabled your own people to possess the land.
\q1

It was not by using their own swords that they conquered the people that lived in that land,
\q2 and it was not by their own power that they were victorious;
\q1 it was only by your power that they did those things;
\q2 and they were sure that you were with them,
\q2 showing that you were pleased with them.
\b
\q1

It is by your power that we knock our enemies down and tramp on them.
\q1

I do not trust that I can save myself
\q2 by using my bow and arrows and my sword.
\q1

We have always been proud about what God has done for us,
\q2 and we will thank him forever.
\b
\q1

You have caused us to run away from our enemies,
\q2 with the result that they captured the things that belonged to us.
\q1

It is as though you sold us, your people, to our enemies for a very small price,
\q2 although you did not gain any profit from selling us!
\b
\q1

They make jokes using the name of our country,
\q2 they shake their heads to indicate that they despise us.
\q1

I hear what those who sneer at me and revile me say;
\q2 I am ashamed in front of my enemies and those who want to harm me.
\b
\q1

All these things have happened to us
\q2 even though we have not forgotten you,
\q2 and we are not the ones who disobeyed the covenant you made with our ancestors.
\q1

We have not stopped being loyal to you,
\q2 and we have not stopped doing what you want us to do.
\q1

But it is as though you have allowed us to be helpless among wild animals
\q2 and you have abandoned us in a deep dark ravine.
\b
\q1

If we had forgotten to worship our God,
\q2 or if we had spread out our hands to worship a foreign god,
\q1

you certainly would have known that
\q2 because you know even what we secretly think.
\q1

But it is because we belong to you
\q2 that our enemies are constantly killing us.
\q1 They act toward us as though we were only sheep that they were going to slaughter.
\b
\q1

So Yahweh, arise! Why are you asleep?
\q2 Get up! Do not reject us forever!
\q

Why are you not looking at us?
\q2 Why are you forgetting that we are suffering, that our enemies are oppressing us?
\b
\q1
