Lord, someday people from all the nations that you have established will come and bow down in front of you,
\q2 and they will praise you.
\q1

You are great, and you do wonderful things;
\q2 only you are God.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, teach me what you want me to do
\q2 so that I may conduct my life according to what you say, all of which is right.
\q1 Cause me to have an awesome respect for you with all my inner being.
\q1

Lord, my God, I will thank you with all my inner being,
\q2 and I will praise you forever.
\q1

You faithfully love me very much as you have promised;
\q2 you have prevented me from dying and going to the place where dead people are.
\b
\q1

Look down toward me and act mercifully to me;
\q2 cause me to be strong and save me,
\q2 the one who serves you faithfully as my mother did.
\q1

\d A psalm written by one of the descendants of Korah
\b
\q1

The city is established on his holy mountain.
\q1

Yahweh loves that city, Jerusalem, more than he loves any other place in Israel.
\q1

You people in Jerusalem,
\q2 other people say wonderful things about your city.
\b
\q1

Some of those who know our God are the people of Egypt and Babylonia,
\q2 and also the people of Philistia and Tyre and Ethiopia;
\q2 someday they all will say,
\q2 "Although I was not born in Jerusalem,
\q2 it is as though I was born there because I belong to Yahweh."
\q1

Concerning Jerusalem, people will say,
\q2 "All of these people were born there,
\q2 and Almighty God will cause that city to remain strong."
\q1

Yahweh will write a list of the names of the people of various groups who belong to him,
\q1 and he will say that he considers them all to be citizens of Jerusalem.
\b
\q1

They will all dance and sing, saying,
\q2 "Jerusalem is the source of all our blessings."

\d A psalm that expresses sadness, written for the choir director by Zerah's son Heman, one of the descendants of Korah
\b
\q1

Yahweh God, you who rescue me, all during each day I call out to you to help me,
\q1 and I cry out to you during each night also.
\q1

Listen to my prayer
\q2 while I cry out to you for help!
\b
\q1

I have experienced many troubles,
\q2 and I am about to die and go where dead people are.
\q1

Because I have no more strength,
\q2 other people believe that I will soon die.
\q1

I am like a corpse that has been abandoned;
\q2 I am like dead people who lie in their graves,
\q2 people who have been completely forgotten
\q2 because you do not take care of them anymore.
\b
\q1

It is as though you have thrown me into a deep, dark pit,
\q2 into a place where they throw corpses.
\q1

It seems as though you are very angry with me,
\q1 and it is as though you have crushed me as ocean waves crash down on people.
\q1

You have caused my friends to avoid me;
\q2 I have become repulsive to them.
\q1 It is as though I were in a prison and cannot escape.
\q1

My eyes cannot see well because I cry very much.
\q2 Yahweh, every day I call out to you to help me;
\q2 I lift up my hands to you while I pray.
\b
\q1

You certainly do not perform miracles for dead people!
\q1 Their spirits do not arise to praise you!
\q1

Corpses in the grave certainly do not tell about your faithfully loving us,
\q2 and in the place where people are finally destroyed,
\q2 no one tells about what you faithfully do for us.
\q1

No one in the deep, dark pit ever sees the miracles that you perform,
\q2 and no one in the place where people have been completely forgotten tells about your being good to us.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, why do you reject me?
\q2 Why do you turn away from me?
\b
\q1

You have caused even my friends and others whom I love to avoid me,
\q2 and it is as though the only friend that I have is darkness.

I will tell people that you will faithfully love us forever,
\q2 and that your being faithful to do what you have promised is as permanent as the sky.
\b
\q1

Yahweh said, "I have made an agreement with David, whom I chose to serve me.
\q2 I have made this solemn agreement with him:
\q1

'I will enable various ones of your descendants to always be kings;
\q2 the line of kings descended from you will never end.'"
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I desire that all those beings who are in heaven will praise you for the wonderful things that you do,
\q2 and that all your holy angels will sing about how you faithfully do what you promise.
\q1

There is no one in heaven who can be compared with you, Yahweh.
\q2 There are no angels in heaven who are equal to you.
\q1

When your holy angels gather together,
\q2 they declare that you must be revered;
\q1 they say that you are more awesome than all the angels that surround your throne!
\q1

O Yahweh God, commander of the angel armies, there is no one who is as powerful as you are;
\q2 your faithfully doing all that you promise is like a cloak that always surrounds you.
\b
\q1

You are the one who crushed and killed the great sea monster named Rahab.
\q2 You defeated and scattered your enemies with your great power.
\q1

You created everything from the north to the south.
\q2 Mount Tabor and Mount Hermon joyfully praise you .
\q1

You are very powerful;
\q2 you are extremely strong.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, how fortunate are those who worship you with joyful shouts in their festivals,
\q2 who live knowing that you are always watching over them.
\q1

Every day, throughout the day, they rejoice in what you have done,
\q2 and they praise you for being very good to them.
\q1

Yahweh, you gave us the one who protects us;
\q2 you, the holy God whom we Israelites worship, he gave us our king.
\b
\q1

Long ago you spoke in a vision to one of your servants, saying,
\q2 "I have crowned a famous soldier;
\q1 I chose him from among all the people to be a king.
\q1

That man is David, the one who will serve me faithfully,
\q2 and I anointed him with sacred olive oil to make him king.
\q1

His enemies will never find ways to outwit him,
\q2 and wicked people will never defeat him.
\q1

I will crush his enemies in front of him
\q2 and get rid of those who hate him.
\q1

I will always be loyal to him and faithfully love him
\q2 and enable him to defeat his enemies.
\q1

I will cause his kingdom to include all the land from the Mediterranean Sea to the Euphrates River.
\q1

He will say to me, 'You are my Father,
\q2 my God, the one who protects and saves me.'
\q1

I will always be loyal to him,
\q2 and my agreement to bless him will last forever.
\q1

I will establish a line of his descendants that will never end,
\q2 various ones of his descendants will always be kings.
\b
\q1

But if some of his descendants disobey my laws
\q2 and do not behave as my commands say that they should,
\q1

if they disregard my requirements
\q2 and do not do the right things that I have told them to do,
\q1

I will punish them severely 
\q2 and cause them to suffer for doing wrong.
\q1

But I will not stop faithfully loving David,
\q2 and I will always do what I promised him.
\q1

That line will be as permanent as the moon
\q2 that is always watching everything here on earth."
\b
\q1

But Yahweh, now you have rejected him!
\q2 You are very angry with the king whom you appointed.
\q1

You have torn down the walls that protect his city
\q2 and allowed all his forts to become ruins.
\q1

You have caused his sword to become useless,
\q2 and you have not helped him in his battles.
\q1

You have caused his splendor to end 
\q2 and knocked his throne to the ground.
\q1

You have caused him to become old when he is still young
\q2 and caused him to be very shamed.
\b
\q1

O Yahweh, how long will this continue?
\q2 Will you hide yourself from us forever?
\q1 How long will your anger against us burn like a fire?
\q1

No one can keep on living and never die;
\q2 no one can bring himself back from the place of the dead.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you promised long ago
\q2 that you would faithfully love me;
\q1 why are you not doing that?
\q1 You solemnly promised this to David!
\q1

Yahweh, do not forget that people insult us!
\q2 Heathen people curse me!
\q1

Yahweh, your enemies insult your chosen king!
\q2 They insult him wherever he goes.
\b
\q1

I hope that Yahweh will be praised forever!
\q1 Amen! May it be so!

Lord, you have always been like a home for us.
\q1

Before you created the mountains,
\q2 before you formed the earth and everything that is in it,
\q1 you were eternally God,
\q2 and you will be God forever.
\b
\q1

When you consider time,
\q2 a thousand years are as short as one day that passes;
\q2 you consider that they are as short as a few hours in the night.
\q1

You cause people to die suddenly;
\q2 they live only a short time as a dream lasts only a short time.
\q2 They are like grass that grows up.
\q1

In the morning the grass sprouts and grows well,
\q2 but in the evening it dries up and completely withers.
\b
\q1

No one has really experienced the powerful things you can do to them when you are angry with them,
\q1 and people are not afraid that you will punish them because of your being angry with them.
\q1

So teach us to realize that we live for only a short time
\q2 in order that we may use our time wisely.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, how long will you be angry with us?
\q1 Pity us who serve you.
\q1

Each morning, show us that it is enough for us if you love us faithfully as you have promised you would do. 
\q2 Show us this so that we may shout joyfully and be happy all during the years that we live.
\q1

Cause us to be now as happy for as many years as you afflicted us and we experienced troubles.
\q1

Enable us to see the great things that you do,
\q2 and enable our descendants to see your glorious power also.
\b
\q1

Those who live under the protection of God Almighty,
\q2 will be able to rest safely under his care.
\q1

I will declare to Yahweh,
\q2 "You protect me;
\q2 you are like a fort in which I am safe.
\q2 You are my God, the one in whom I trust."
\b
\q1

He will rescue you from all hidden traps
\q2 and save you from deadly diseases.
\q1

He will shield you as a bird protects her young under her wings.
\q2 You will be safe in his care.
\q2 His faithfully doing what he has promised is like a shield that will protect you.
\q1

You will not be afraid of things that happen during the night that could terrorize you
\q2 or of arrows that your enemies will shoot at you during the day.
\q1

You will not be afraid of plagues that demons cause when they attack people at night
\q2 or of other evil forces that kill people at midday.
\q1

Even if a thousand people fall dead alongside you,
\q2 even if ten thousand people are dying around you,
\q2 you will not be harmed.
\q1

Look and see
\q2 that wicked people are being punished!
\b
\q1

because Yahweh will command his angels
\q2 to protect you in whatever you are doing.
\q1

They will hold you up with their hands
\q2 so that you will not hurt your foot on a big stone.
\q1

You will be kept safe from being harmed by your enemies;
\q2 it will be as though you were killing strong lions and poisonous snakes by stepping on them!
\b
\q1

When they call out to me, I will answer them.
\q2 I will help them when they are experiencing trouble;
\q2 I will rescue them and honor them.
\q1

I will reward them by enabling them to live a long time,
\q2 and I will save them."

\d A psalm that is to be sung on Sabbath days.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, it is good for people to thank you
\q2 and to sing praise to you who are greater than any other god.
\q1

It is good to proclaim every morning that you faithfully love us
\q2 and to sing songs each night that declare that you always do what you have promised to do,
\q2

accompanied by musicians playing harps that have ten strings
\q2 and by the sounds made by a lyre.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, the things that you do are great!
\q2 But it is difficult to understand all that you think.
\q1

There are things that you do that foolish people cannot know about,
\q2 things that stupid people cannot understand.
\q1

They do not understand that although the number of wicked people increases as blades of grass do
\q2 and that those who do what is evil prosper,
\q1 they will be completely destroyed.
\b
\q1

But Yahweh, you will be king forever.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, your enemies will certainly die,
\q2 and those who do wicked things will be defeated.
\q1

I have seen you defeat my enemies,
\q2 and I have heard those evil men wail while they were being slaughtered.
\b
\q1

But righteous people will prosper like palm trees that grow well,
\q2 like the cedar trees that grow in Lebanon.
\q1

They are like the trees that people plant at the temple of Yahweh in Jerusalem,
\q2 the trees that are close to the courtyard of the temple of our God.
\q1

Even when righteous people become old, they do many things that please God.
\q2 They remain strong and full of energy like trees that remain full of sap.
\q2

Yahweh, you have become the King!
\q2 The majesty and the power that you have are like robes that a king wears.
\q1 You put the world firmly in place, and it will never be moved out of its place.
\q1

You started to rule as king a very long time ago;
\q2 you have always existed.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, when you created the world, you separated the water from the chaotic mass and formed oceans,
\q2 and the waves of the waters of those oceans still roar,
\q1

but you are greater than the roar of those oceans,
\q2 more powerful than the ocean waves!
\q2 You are Yahweh, the one who is greater than any other god!
\b
\q1

Yahweh, your laws never change,
\q2 and your temple has always been holy.
\q2 That will be true forever.

Yahweh, you are able to get revenge on your enemies.
\q2 So show them that you are going to punish them!
\b
\q1

Yahweh, how long will those wicked people be glad?
\q2 It is not right that they continue being glad!
\b
\q1

They murder widows and orphans
\q2 and people from other countries who think it is safe to live in our land.
\q2

Those wicked people say, "Yahweh does not see anything;
\q2 the God whom those Israelites worship does not see the evil things that we do."
\b
\q1

Yahweh knows everything that people are thinking;
\q2 he knows that what they think is evil and useless.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, how fortunate are those who allow you to discipline them,
\q2 those who want you to teach them your laws.
\q1

When those people have had troubles, you cause those troubles to cease,
\q1 and someday it will be as though you will dig pits for the wicked people,
\q2 and that they will fall into those pits and die.
\q1

Someday judges will decide matters fairly for people,
\q2 and all honest people will be pleased about that.
\b
\q1

But when wicked people oppressed me,
\q1 no one defended me!
\q2 No one stood up to testify for me against those evil people.
\q1

If Yahweh had not helped me at that time,
\q2 I would have been executed;
\q2 my life would have gone to the place where dead people say nothing.
\q1

I said, "I am falling into disaster,"
\q2 but, Yahweh, you held me up by faithfully loving me.
\q1

Whenever I am very worried,
\q2 you comfort me and cause me to be happy.
\b
\q1

You have nothing to do with wicked judges,
\q2 those who establish laws that allow people to do what is not right.
\q1

They plan to get rid of righteous people,
\q1 and they declare that innocent people must be executed.
\q1

We should thank him as we come before him
\q2 and sing joyful songs as we praise him.
\b
\q1

Because Yahweh is a great God,
\q2 he is a great king who rules over all other gods.
\q1

He rules over the whole earth
\q2 from the deepest places to the highest mountains.
\q1

The seas are his because he made them.
\q2 He is the one who made the dry land.
\b
\q1

We should come, worship, and bow down before him.
\q2 We should kneel before Yahweh, the one who made us.
\q1

He is our God,
\q2 and we are the people whom he protects,
\q2 like sheep that a shepherd takes care of.
\b
\q1 I desire that today you may hear what Yahweh is saying to you.
\q2

He says, "Do not become stubborn as your ancestors did at Meribah,
\q2 and as they did at Massah in the wilderness.
\q1

There your ancestors wanted to see if they could do evil things without my punishing them.
\q2 Even though they had seen me perform many miracles, they tested whether I would continue to be patient with them.
\q1

For forty years I was angry with those people,
\q2 and I said, 'Those people are unreliable.
\q2 They refuse to obey my commands.'
\q1

So because I was very angry; I solemnly said about them,
\q2 'They will never enter the land of Canaan where I would have allowed them to rest!'"

Sing to Yahweh a new song!
\q1 You people throughout the earth, sing to Yahweh!
\q1

Sing to Yahweh and praise him!
\q2 Every day proclaim to others that he has saved us.
\q1

Tell about his glory to all people groups;
\q2 tell all people groups the marvelous things that he has done.
\b
\q1

All the gods the other people groups worship are only idols,
\q2 but Yahweh is truly great; he created the skies!
\q1

Those who are in his presence honor him and can see that he is a great king.
\q2 They can see in his temple that he is very powerful and is very beautiful.
\b
\q1

You people in nations all over the earth, praise Yahweh!
\q1 Praise Yahweh for his glorious power!
\q1

Bow down before Yahweh when he appears in his glorious temple.
\q2 Everyone on earth should be very afraid in his presence, because he is good and powerful, completely different than us.
\b
\q1

Say to all the people groups, "Yahweh is the king!
\q2 He put the world in its place, and nothing will ever be able to move it.
\q1 He will judge all the people groups fairly."
\q1

All the beings that are in the heavens should be glad, and all the people on the earth should rejoice.
\q2 The oceans and all the creatures that are in the oceans should roar to praise Yahweh.
\q1

The fields and everything that grows in them should rejoice.
\q1 When they do that, it will be as though all the trees in the forests are singing joyfully
\q2

in front of Yahweh.
\q1 That will happen when he comes to judge everyone on the earth.
\q2 He will judge all the people fairly according to what he knows is true.

Yahweh is the king!
\q2 I want everyone on the earth to be glad
\q2 and the people who live on the islands in the oceans to also rejoice about that!
\b
\q1

He sends fire in front of him,
\q2 and he completely burns all his enemies in that fire.
\q1

The mountains melt like wax in front of Yahweh,
\q2 in front of the one who is the Lord, who rules over all the earth.
\q1

The angels in heaven proclaim that he acts righteously,
\q2 and all the people groups see his glory.
\b
\q1

Everyone who worships idols should be ashamed;
\q2 all those who are proud of their false gods should realize that their gods are useless.
\q1 All those gods will bow down to worship Yahweh.
\b
\q1

The people of Jerusalem heard that God is just, and they rejoiced;
\q2 people in the other cities in Judah also rejoiced
\q2 because Yahweh judges and punishes wicked people.
\q1

Yahweh is the supreme King over all the earth;
\q2 he has very great power, and none of the other gods has any power.
\b
\q1

Yahweh loves those who hate what people do that is evil;
\q2 he protects the lives of his people,
\q2 and he rescues them when the wicked people try to harm them.
\q1

You righteous people, rejoice about what Yahweh has done,
\q2 and thank him, our holy God!

\d A psalm.
\b
\q1

Sing to Yahweh a new song
\q1 because he has done wonderful things!
\q1 By his power he has defeated his enemies.
\q1

Yahweh has declared to people that he has defeated his enemies;
\q2 he has revealed that he has punished his enemies,
\q2 and people in all the world have seen that he has done it.
\q1

As he promised to us Israelite people,
\q2 he has faithfully loved us and been loyal to us.
\q1 People who live in very remote places in all the earth
\q2 have seen that our God has defeated his enemies.
\b
\q1

Praise Yahweh while you play the lyres,
\q2 playing delightful music.
\q1

Some of you should blow trumpets and other horns
\q2 while others shout joyfully to Yahweh, our king.
\b
\q1

The oceans and all the creatures that are in the oceans should roar to praise Yahweh.
\q1 Everyone on the earth should sing!
\q1

It should seem as though the rivers were clapping their hands to praise Yahweh
\q2 and that the hills were singing together joyfully in front of Yahweh
\q1

because he will come to judge everyone on the earth!
\q2 He will judge all the people groups in the world justly and fairly.

Yahweh is the supreme king,
\q1 so all the people groups should tremble in his presence!
\q1 He sits on his throne in the temple above the statues of winged creatures,
\q2 so the earth should quake!
\q1

They should praise him because he is very great;
\q2 he is holy!
\b
\q1

Praise Yahweh, our God!
\q2 Worship him in front of his footstool, the sacred chest in his temple,
\q2 where he rules people.
\q2 He is holy!
\b
\q1

Moses and Aaron were two of his priests;
\q1 Samuel also was someone who prayed to him.
\q1 Those three cried out to Yahweh to help them,
\q2 and he answered them.
\q1

He spoke to Moses and Aaron from the cloud that was like a huge pillar;
\q2 they obeyed all the laws and commandments that he gave to them.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, our God, you answered your people
\q2 when they cried out to you to help them;
\q1 you are a God who forgave them for the sins that they had committed,
\q1 even though you punished them for the things that they did that were wrong.
\q1

\d A psalm of thanksgiving
\b
\q1

Everyone in the world should shout joyfully to Yahweh!
\q2

We should worship Yahweh gladly!
\q2 We should come before him singing joyful songs.
\q1

Enter the gates of his temple thanking him;
\q2 enter the courtyard of the temple singing songs to praise him!
\q1 Thank him and praise him
\q1

because Yahweh always does good things for us.
\q2 He faithfully loves us as he promised us,
\q2 and he is faithful.

\d A psalm written by David
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I will sing to you!
\q1 I will sing about your faithful and just loyalty to us.
\q1

I promise that while I rule people,
\q2 I will behave in such a way that no one will be able to criticize me.
\q2 Yahweh, when will you come to help me?
\q1 I will do things that are right.
\b
\q1

I will not allow anyone who does what is evil to come to me.
\q1 I hate the deeds of those who turn away from you;
\q2 I will completely avoid those people.
\b
\q1

I will not be dishonest,
\q2 and I will not have anything to do with evil.
\b
\q1

I will get rid of anyone who secretly slanders someone else,
\q1 and I will not let anyone near me who is proud and arrogant.
\b
\q1

I will approve of people in this land who are loyal to God,
\q1 and I will allow them to live with me.
\q2 I will allow to serve me those who behave in such a way that no one can criticize them.
\b
\q1

I will not allow anyone who deceives others to work in my palace,
\q1 and no one who tells lies will be allowed to continually come to work for me.
\b
\q1

Every day I will try to get rid of all the wicked people in this land;
\q1 I will expel them from this city, which is Yahweh's city.

\d A prayer written by someone who was afflicted, when he was discouraged and pleaded for Yahweh to help.
\b
\q1

Do not turn away!
\q1 Listen to me,
\q2 and answer me quickly now when I am calling out to you!
\b
\q1

I feel as though I am drying up like grass that has been mown,
\q2 and I do not even think about eating any food.
\q1

I groan loudly,
\q2 and my bones can be seen under my skin because I have become very thin.
\q1

I am like a lonely and despised vulture in the desert,
\q2 like an owl by itself in the abandoned ruins of a building.
\q1

I lie awake at night;
\q2 because there is no one to comfort me,
\q2 I am like a lonely bird sitting on a housetop.
\q1

All during each day my enemies insult me;
\q2 those who make fun of me mention my name
\q2 and say, "May you be like him" when they curse people.
\q1

9-10 Because you are very angry with me,
\q1 I sit in ashes while I am suffering greatly;
\q2 those ashes fall on the bread that I eat,
\q2 and what I drink has my tears mixed with it.
\q1 It is as though you have picked me up and thrown me away!
\q1

My time to remain alive is short
\q2 like an evening shadow that will soon be gone.
\q2 I am withering as grass withers in the hot sun.
\b
\q1

Even though the city has been destroyed,
\q2 we who serve you still love the stones that were formerly in the city walls;
\q1 because now there is rubble everywhere,
\q2 we, your people, are very sad when we see it.
\q1

You will rebuild Jerusalem,
\q2 and you will appear there with your glory.
\q1

You will listen to the prayers of your people who are homeless,
\q2 and you will not ignore them
\q2 when they plead with you to help them.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I want to write these words
\q2 so that people in future years will know what you have done,
\q2 in order that people who are not born yet will praise you.
\q1

They will know that you looked down from your own place in heaven
\q1 and saw what was happening on the earth.
\q1

They will know that you hear prisoners groaning
\q2 and that you will set free those who have been told, "You will be executed."
\q1

As a result, people in Jerusalem will praise you for what you have done.
\q2

Many people from other people groups and those who are citizens of other kingdoms will gather to worship you.
\b
\q1

I say to you, "My God, do not take me away from the earth now
\q2 before I become old!
\q1 You, on the other hand, live forever!
\q1

You created the world long ago,
\q2 and you made the heavens with your own hands.
\q1

The earth and the heavens will disappear, but you will remain.
\q2 They will wear out as clothes wear out.
\q1 You will get rid of them as people get rid of old clothes,
\q2 and they will no longer exist.
\q1

But you are not like the things that you created
\q2 because you are always the same;
\q2 you never die.
\q1

Someday our children will live safely in Jerusalem,
\q1 and their descendants will be protected as they live in your presence."

I tell myself that I should praise Yahweh.
\q2 I will praise him because he is holy.
\q1

I tell myself that I should praise Yahweh
\q2 and never forget all the kind things he has done for me.
\q1

he keeps me from dying,
\q2 and he blesses me by faithfully loving me and acting mercifully to me as he promised to do.
\q1

He gives me good things during my entire life.
\q2 He makes me feel young and strong like eagles.
\b
\q1

Yahweh judges justly all those who have been treated unfairly.
\q1

He will not keep rebuking us,
\q2 and he will not remain angry forever.
\q1

He has not punished us for our sins as we deserved.
\q1

The skies are very high above the earth,
\q2 and Yahweh's faithful love for all those who revere him is just as great.
\q1

He has taken away the guilt for our sins
\q2 and put it as far from us as the east is from the west.
\q1

Just as parents act mercifully toward their children,
\q2 Yahweh is kind to those who revere him.
\q1

He knows what our bodies are like;
\q2 he remembers that he created us from dust
\q2 and that we therefore quickly fail to do what pleases him .
\q1

But Yahweh will faithfully keep loving forever
\q2 all those who revere him, as he promised.
\q2 He will act fairly to our children and to their children;
\q1

he will act that way to all those who obey the covenant he made with them to bless them if they did what he told them to do,
\q2 to all those who obey what he has commanded.
\b
\q1

You angels who belong to Yahweh, praise him!
\q2 You are powerful creatures who do what he tells you to do;
\q2 you obey what he commands.
\q1

Praise Yahweh, you armies of angels who serve him and do what he desires.
\q1

All you things that Yahweh has created, praise him;
\q2 praise him in every place where he rules, everywhere!
\b
\q1 I also will praise Yahweh!

I tell myself that I should praise Yahweh.
\q1 Yahweh, my God, you are very great!
\q2 As a king has on his royal robes,
\q1 you have honor and majesty all around you!
\q1

You created light and you hide behind it.
\q2 You spread out the whole sky as someone sets up a tent.
\q2

You built your palace on the clouds.
\q1 You made the clouds to be like chariots to carry you.
\q1

You caused the winds to be like your messengers,
\q1 and flames of fire to be like your servants.
\b
\q1

You placed the world firmly on its foundation
\q2 so that it can never be moved.
\q1

But when you rebuked the water, the oceans receded;
\q2 your voice spoke like thunder,
\q1 and then the waters rushed away.
\q1

Mountains rose up from the water,
\q2 and the valleys sank down
\q2 to the levels that you had determined for them.
\q1

Then you set a boundary for the oceans, a boundary that they cannot cross;
\q2 their water will never again cover the whole earth.
\b
\q1

Birds make their nests alongside the streams,
\q2 and they sing among the branches of the trees.
\q1

From the heavens you send rain down on the mountains,
\q2 and you fill the earth with many good things that you create.
\q1

You make grass to grow for the cattle to eat,
\q2 and you make plants to grow for people.
\q2 In that way, animals and people get their food from what grows in the soil.
\q1

We get grapes to make wine to drink and to make us cheerful;
\q2 we get olives to make our face shine,
\q2 and we get grain to make bread to give us strength.
\q1

Yahweh, you send plenty of rain to water your trees,
\q2 the cedar trees that you planted in Lebanon.
\q1

Birds make their nests in those trees,
\q2 and storks make their nests in pine trees.
\q1

High up in the mountains the wild goats live,
\q2 and hyraxes live in the rocks.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you made the moon to indicate the times for our festivals,
\q2 and you made the sun that knows when to go down.
\q1

You bring darkness, and it becomes night
\q2 when all the animals in the forest prowl around looking for food.
\q1

At night the young lions roar as they seek their prey,
\q2 but they depend on you to give them food.
\q1

At dawn, they go back to their dens and lie down.
\q1

During the daytime, people go to their work;
\q2 they work until it is evening.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you have made so many different kinds of things!
\q2 You were very wise as you made them all.
\q2 The earth is full of the creatures that you made.
\q1

We see the ocean which is very vast!
\q2 It is full of many kinds of living creatures,
\q2 big ones and little ones.
\q1

We see the ships which sail along!
\q2 We see the huge sea monster which you made to splash around in the sea.
\b
\q1

All of these creatures depend on you
\q2 to give them the food that they need.
\q1

When you give them the food that they need,
\q2 they gather it.
\q1 You give them what you have in your hand,
\q2 and they eat it and are satisfied.
\q1

But if you refuse to give food to them,
\q2 they become terrified.
\q1 When you cause them to stop breathing, they die;
\q2 their bodies decay and become soil again.
\q1

When you cause newborn creatures to begin to breathe,
\q2 they start to live;
\q2 You give new life to all the living creatures on the earth.
\b
\q1

May the glory of Yahweh last forever.
\q2 May he rejoice about all the things that he has created.
\q1

He makes the earth shake just by looking at it!
\q2 By merely touching the mountains he makes them pour out fire and smoke!
\b
\q1

I will sing to Yahweh as long as I live.
\q2 I will praise my God until the day that I die.
\q1

May Yahweh be pleased by all these things that I have thought about him
\q2 because I rejoice about knowing him.
\q1

However, may sinners disappear from the earth;
\q2 may there will be no more wicked people!
\b
\q1 But as for me, I will praise Yahweh!
\b
\q1 Praise him!

Give thanks to Yahweh; worship him and pray to him.
\q2 Tell everyone in the world what he has done!
\q1

Be proud of Yahweh, who alone is God.
\q2 You people who worship Yahweh, rejoice!
\q1

Ask Yahweh to help you and give you his strength,
\q2 and always seek to be with him!
\b
\q1

5-6 You people who are descendants of God's servant Abraham,
\q2 you descendants of Jacob, the people whom God has chosen,
\q2 think about all the wonderful things that he has done;
\q2 he performed miracles, and he punished all our enemies.
\q1

He is Yahweh, our God.
\q1 He rules and judges people throughout the earth.
\b
\q1

That is the covenant that he made with Abraham,
\q2 and he repeated that covenant with Isaac.
\q1

Later he confirmed it again to Jacob
\q2 as a covenant for the Israelite people that would last forever.
\q1

What he said was, "I will give you the region of Canaan;
\q2 it will belong to you and your descendants forever."
\b
\q1

He said that to them when there were only a few of them,
\q2 a tiny group of people who were living in that land like strangers.
\q1

They continued to wander from one place to another,
\q2 from one kingdom to another.
\q1

But he did not allow others to oppress them.
\q2 He warned those kings by saying to them,
\q1

"Do not do harm to the people whom I have chosen!
\q2 Do not harm my prophets!"
\b
\q1

He sent a famine to Canaan, and as a result all the people had no food to eat.
\q1

So his people went to Egypt, but first he sent someone there.
\q2 He sent Joseph, who had been sold to be a slave.
\q1

Later, while Joseph was in prison in Egypt,
\q2 they put his legs in shackles that hurt his feet,
\q1 and they put an iron collar around his neck.
\q1

Joseph was in prison until the time
\q the events he predicted came to pass. 
\q This was how Yahweh tested Joseph. 
\q1

Then he appointed him to take care of everything in the king's household,
\q2 to take care of everything that the king possessed.
\q1

Joseph was permitted to command the king's important servants
\q2 to do anything that Joseph wanted them to do,
\q2 and even to tell the king's advisors the things that they should do for the people of Egypt.
\b
\q1

Later, Joseph's father Jacob arrived in Egypt.
\q2 He lived like a foreigner in the land that belonged to the descendants of Ham.
\q1

Years later Yahweh caused the descendants of Jacob to become very numerous.
\q2 As a result, their enemies, the Egyptians, considered that the Israelites were too strong.
\q1

So Yahweh caused the rulers of Egypt to turn against the Israelite people,
\q2 and they began to oppress his people.
\q1

But then Yahweh sent his servant Moses
\q2 along with Moses' older brother Aaron, whom Yahweh had also chosen to be his servant.
\q1

Those two performed amazing miracles among the people of Egypt
\q2 in that land where the descendants of Ham lived.
\q1

Yahweh sent darkness so that the people of Egypt could not see anything,
\q2 but the rulers of Egypt refused to obey when Moses and Aaron commanded them to let the Israelite people leave Egypt.
\q1

Yahweh caused all the water in Egypt to become blood,
\q2 and his doing that caused all the fish to die.
\q1

Then Yahweh commanded that flies come, and swarms of them descended on the people of Egypt,
\q2 and gnats also swarmed across the whole country.
\q1

Yahweh sent rain, rain that became hail that fell upon them,
\q2 and he sent wild fires that burned throughout their land.
\q1

The hail ruined their grapevines and fig trees
\q2 and shattered all the other trees.
\q1

The locusts ate every green plant in the land,
\q2 ruining all the crops.
\q1

Then Yahweh killed the oldest son in every house of the people of Egypt.
\b
\q1

Then he brought the Israelite people out from Egypt;
\q2 they were carrying heavy loads of jewelry made of silver and gold that the people of Egypt had given to them.
\q1 No one was left behind because of being sick.
\q1

The people of Egypt were glad when the Israelite people left
\q2 because they had become very afraid of the Israelites.
\q1

Later the Israelites asked for meat to eat,
\q2 and Yahweh sent flocks of quail to them,
\q1 and he gave them plenty of manna, food from the sky, each morning.
\q1

One day he caused a rock to open up, and water poured out for them to drink;
\q2 it was like a river flowing in that desert.
\b
\q1

He did that because he kept thinking about the sacred promise that he had given to his servant, Abraham.
\q1

He gave to them the land that belonged to the people groups that lived there in Canaan,
\q2 and the Israelites took all their wealth.
\q1

Yahweh did all these things
\q2 so that his people would do all the things that he had commanded them to do.
\b
\q1 Praise Yahweh!

Praise Yahweh!
\q1 Praise Yahweh because he everything he does is good;
\q2 he faithfully loves us forever as he promised us!
\q1

Because Yahweh has done many great things,
\q2 no one can tell all the great things that Yahweh has done,
\q2 and no one can praise him enough.
\q

How fortunate are those who act fairly,
\q2 those who always do what is right.
\q1

Allow me to see your people become prosperous again
\q2 and to see all the people of your nation, Israel, become happy again;
\q2 allow me to be happy with them!
\q2 I want to praise you along with all those others who belong to you.
\b
\q1

When our ancestors were in Egypt,
\q2 they did not pay attention to the wonderful things that Yahweh did;
\q2 they forgot about the many times that he showed that he faithfully loved them.
\q1 Instead, when they were at the Sea of Reeds,
\q2 they rebelled against God, who is greater than any other god.
\q1

But he rescued them for the sake of his own reputation
\q2 so that he could show that he is very powerful.
\q1

He rebuked the Sea of Reeds and it became dry,
\q2 and then while he led our ancestors,
\q2 they walked through it as though it were as dry as a desert.
\q1

In that way he rescued them from the power of their enemies.
\q1

When that happened, our ancestors believed that Yahweh had truly done for them what he had promised to do,
\q2 and they sang to praise him.
\b
\q1

They intensely wanted food like they formerly ate in Egypt.
\q2 They did evil things to find out whether God would punish them or not.
\q1

So he gave them what they requested,
\q2 but he also caused a terrible disease to afflict them.
\b
\q1

Later when some of the men became jealous of Moses
\q1 and his older brother Aaron, who was dedicated to serve Yahweh by being a priest,
\q1

the ground opened up and swallowed Dathan
\q2 and also buried Abiram and his family.
\q1

God sent down from heaven a fire
\q2 which burned up all the wicked people who supported them.
\b
\q1

Then the Israelite leaders made a gold statue of a calf at Mount Sinai 
\q2 and worshiped it.
\q1

Instead of worshiping our glorious God,
\q2 they started to worship a statue of an ox that eats grass!
\q1

They forgot about God, who had rescued them by the great miracles that he performed in Egypt.
\q1

They forgot about the wonderful things that he did for them in Egypt
\q2 and the amazing things that he did for them at the Sea of Reeds.
\q1

Because of that, God said that he would get rid of the Israelites;
\q2 but Moses, whom God had chosen to serve him, stood up to persuade God not to do that.
\q2 As a result, God did not destroy them.
\b
\q1

Later, our ancestors refused to enter the beautiful land of Canaan
\q2 because they did not believe that God would do as he promised and would enable them to take the land from the people who were living there.
\q1

They stayed in their tents and grumbled
\q2 and would not pay attention to what Yahweh said that they should do.
\q1

So he solemnly told them
\q2 that he would cause them to die there in the wilderness,
\q2

that he would scatter their descendants among the people of other nations and groups who did not believe in him,
\q2 and that he would allow them to die in those lands.
\b
\q1

Later the Israelite people started to worship the idol of Baal at Mount Peor,
\q1 and they ate meat that had been sacrificed to Baal and those other lifeless gods.
\q1

Yahweh became very angry because of what they had done,
\q2 so again he sent a terrible disease to attack them.
\q1

But Phinehas stood up and punished the ones who had sinned greatly,
\q2 and as a result the plague ended.
\q1

People have remembered that righteous deed that Phinehas did,
\q2 and in future years people will remember it.
\b
\q1

Then at the springs of Meribah our ancestors caused Yahweh to become angry again,
\q2 and as a result Moses had trouble.
\q1

They caused Moses to become very angry,
\q2 and he said things that were foolish.
\b
\q1

Our ancestors did not destroy the other people groups
\q2 as he told them to do.
\q1

Instead, the men took women from those people groups,
\q2 and they started to do the evil things that those people did.
\q1

Our ancestors worshiped the idols of those people,
\q2 which resulted in their being destroyed.
\q1

Some of the Israelites sacrificed their sons and daughters to the demons that those idols represented.
\q1

They killed children who had done nothing wrong,
\q1 and offered them as sacrifices to the idols in Canaan.
\q2 As a result, the land of Canaan was polluted by those murders.
\q1

So by their deeds they made it impossible for God to accept them;
\q2 because they did not faithfully worship only God,
\q2 they became like women who sleep with other men instead of sleeping only with their husbands.
\b
\q1

As a result, he allowed people groups who did not believe in him to conquer them,
\q2 so those who hated our ancestors started to rule over them.
\q1

Their enemies oppressed them
\q2 and completely controlled them.
\q1

Many times Yahweh rescued his people,
\q2 but they continued to rebel against him,
\q2 and they were finally destroyed because of the sins that they committed.
\b
\q1

However, Yahweh always heard them when they cried out to him,
\q2 and he listened to them when they were distressed.
\q1

For their sake, he thought about the covenant that he had made to bless them;
\q2 because he never stopped loving them very much,
\q2 he changed his mind about punishing them more.
\q1

He caused all those who had taken the Israelites to Babylonia to feel sorry for them.
\b
\q1

Yahweh our God, rescue us
\q1 and bring us back to Israel from among those people groups
\q2 so that we may thank you 
\q2 and joyfully praise you.
\b
\q1

Praise Yahweh, the God whom we Israelites worship,
\q1 praise him now and forever!
\b
\q1 All the people should agree!
\q2 Praise Yahweh!

Give thanks to Yahweh because he always does good things for us!
\q2 His faithful love for us lasts forever, as he has promised us!
\q1

Those whom Yahweh has saved should tell others
\q2 that he has rescued them from their enemies.
\q1

He has gathered those of you who were exiled to many lands;
\q2 he has gathered you together from the east and the west,
\q2 from the north and from the south.
\b
\q1

They were hungry and thirsty,
\q2 and they even collapsed in exhaustion.
\q1

When they were in trouble, they called out to Yahweh,
\q2 and he rescued them from being distressed.
\q1

He led them along a straight road where they walked safely
\q2 to cities in Canaan where they could live.
\q1

They should praise Yahweh for loving them faithfully
\q2 and for the wonderful things that he does for people.
\q1

He gives thirsty people plenty of water to drink,
\q2 and he gives hungry people plenty of good things to eat.
\b
\q1

They were in prison because they had rebelled against the message of God;
\q1 they were there because they had despised the advice given by God,
\q2 who is greater than all other gods.
\q1

When they were in trouble, they called out to Yahweh,
\q2 and he rescued them from being distressed.
\q1

He broke the chains that were on their hands and feet
\q2 and brought them out of those very dark prisons.
\q1

15-16 He broke down the prison gates that were made of bronze;
\q2 he cut through the prison bars that were made of iron.
\q1 They should praise Yahweh for loving them faithfully
\q2 and for the wonderful things that he does for people.
\b
\q1

Some of them foolishly rebelled against God,
\q2 so they suffered for their sins.
\q1

They did not want to eat any food,
\q2 and they almost died.
\q1

When they were in trouble, they called out to Yahweh,
\q2 and he rescued them from being distressed.
\q1

They should praise Yahweh for loving them faithfully
\q2 and for the wonderful things that he does for people.
\q1

They should give offerings to him to show that they are thankful,
\q2 and they should sing joyfully about the miracles that he has performed.
\b
\q1

As they were sailing, they also saw the miracles that Yahweh performed,
\q2 the wonderful things that he did when they were on very deep seas.
\q1

He gave orders to the winds, and they became strong
\q2 and stirred up high waves.
\q1

The ships in which they were sailing were tossed high in the air,
\q2 and then they sank into the troughs between the high waves;
\q1 then the sailors were terrified at the danger.
\q1

They stumbled about and staggered like drunken men,
\q2 and they did not know what to do.
\q1

When they were in trouble, they called out to Yahweh,
\q2 and he rescued them from being distressed.
\q1

He calmed the storm
\q2 and he stilled the waves.
\q1

They should praise Yahweh for loving them faithfully
\q2 and for the wonderful things that he does for people.
\q1

They should praise him among the Israelite people when they have gathered together,
\q2 and they should praise him in front of the leaders of the country.
\b
\q1

Sometimes Yahweh causes rivers to become dry,
\q2 with the result that the land becomes a wilderness,
\q2 and springs of water become dry land.
\q1

Sometimes he causes land that has produced lots of crops to become salty wastelands,
\q2 with the result that they do not produce crops.
\q2 He does that because the people who live there are very wicked.
\q1

But sometimes he causes pools of water to appear in deserts,
\q2 and he causes springs to flow in very dry ground.
\q1

He brings hungry people into that land, to live there and to build cities there.
\q1

They plant seeds in their fields,
\q2 and they plant grapevines that produce large crops of grapes.
\q1

He blesses the people, and the women give birth to many children,
\q2 and they have large herds of cattle.
\b
\q1

When the number of people became smaller and they were humiliated by their enemies
\q2 by being oppressed and caused to suffer,
\q1

Yahweh shows contempt for the leaders who oppress them,
\q2 and makes them to wander in a wilderness where there are no roads.
\q1

But he rescues poor people from being in misery
\q2 and causes their families to increase in number like flocks of sheep.
\q1

People who live rightly see God do these things, and they rejoice;
\q2 wicked people hear about these things, too,
\q2 but they have nothing to say against Yahweh in reply.
\b
\q1

Those who are wise should think carefully about these things;
\q2 they should consider all the things that Yahweh has done to show that he faithfully loves them.

God, I am very confident in you.
\q1 I will sing to praise you.
\q2 It is an honor to wake up and praise you.
\q1

I will arise before the sun rises,
\q2 and I will praise you while I play my harp and my lyre.
\q1

because your faithful love for us reaches up to the heavens,
\q2 and you are as faithful in keeping your promises as the clouds are high above the earth.
\q1

Yahweh, show in the heavens that you are very great!
\q2 Show your glory to people all over the earth!
\b
\q1

Answer our prayers and, by your powe,r help us to defeat our enemies
\q1 so that we, the people whom you love, may be saved."
\q1

Yahweh answered our prayers and spoke from his temple, saying, "Because I have conquered your enemies, I will joyfully divide the city of Shechem,
\q2 and I will distribute among my people the land in the Valley of Succoth.
\q1

Because we want to attack the people of Edom,
\q1 who will lead my army to their capital city that has strong walls around it?
\q

We need you to help us when we fight against our enemies
\q2 because the help that humans can give us is worthless.
\q1

But with you helping us, we shall win;
\q2 you will enable us to defeat our enemies.

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director.
\b
\q1

God, you are the one whom I praise,
\q1 so please answer my prayer
\q1

because wicked people slander me
\q2 and tell lies about me.
\q1

They are constantly saying that they hate me,
\q1 and they harm me for no reason.
\q1

I show them that I love them
\q1 and that I pray for them,
\q2 but instead of being kind to me, they say that I have done evil things.
\q1

In return for my doing good things for them and loving them,
\q2 they do evil things to me and hate me.
\b
\q1

So appoint a wicked judge who will judge my enemy,
\q1 and bring in one of his enemies who will stand up and accuse him.
\q1

When the trial ends,
\q2 cause the judge to declare that he is guilty
\q2 and cause even his plea for mercy to be considered a sin.
\q1

Cause his children not to have a father anymore,
\q2 and cause his wife to become a widow.
\q1

Cause his children to leave the ruined homes that they have been living in
\q2 and to wander around begging for food.
\q1

Cause all his children to die,
\q2 so that no one will live to carry on his name.
\q1

Yahweh, remember and do not forgive his ancestors for the evil things that they did,
\q2 and do not even forgive the sins that his mother committed.
\q1

Think about his sins continually,
\q2 but cause everyone living to completely forget who he was.
\b
\q1

I pray these things because that man, my enemy, never acted toward anyone as your covenant says we must;
\q2 he persecuted poor and needy people
\q2 and even killed helpless people.
\q1

He liked to curse people.
\q2 So those terrible things that he requested to happen to others—cause them to happen to him!
\q1 He did not want to bless others,
\q2 so make sure that no one blesses him!
\q1

He often cursed other people, also;
\q2 cause the terrible things that he wanted to happen to others to happen to him and enter his body as water does,
\q2 as olive oil soaks into a person's bones when it is rubbed on his skin.
\q1

Cause those terrible things to cling to him like his clothes
\q1 and be around him like the belt that he wears every day.
\q1

Yahweh, I wish that you will punish all my enemies that way,
\q2 those who say evil things about me.
\b
\q1

But Yahweh, my God, do good things for me
\q2 in order that I may honor you;
\q1 rescue me from my enemies
\q2 because you faithfully love me as you promised.
\q1

I request you to do this because I am poor and needy
\q2 and my inner being is full of pain.
\q1

I think that my time to remain alive is as short
\q2 as an evening shadow that will soon disappear.
\q2 I will be blown away as a locust is blown by the wind.
\q1

My knees are weak because I have fasted very often,
\q2 and my body has become very thin.
\q1

Yahweh, my God, help me!
\q1 Because you faithfully love me, rescue me!
\q1

When you save me,
\q2 cause my enemies to know that you are the one who has done it!
\q1

They may curse me, but I ask that you bless me.
\q2 Cause those who persecute me to be defeated and disgraced, 
\q1 but cause me to be glad!
\q1

Cause those who accuse me to be completely disgraced;
\q2 cause other people to see that they are disgraced as easily as they see the clothes that they wear!
\b
\q1

I will do that because he defends poor people like me
\q2 and because he saves us from those who have said that we must die.

Yahweh said to my lord the king,
\q1 "Sit here, close to me, in the place of highest honor 
\q2 until I completely defeat your enemies 
\q2 and make them like a stool for your feet!"
\b
\q1

Yahweh will extend your power as king
\q2 from Jerusalem to other lands;
\q2 you will rule over all your enemies.
\q1

On the day that you lead your armies into battle,
\q2 many of your people will volunteer to join your army.
\q1 Your youthful strength will act for you like the dew that waters the earth early in the morning."
\b
\q1

Yahweh has made a solemn promise
\q2 and he will never change his mind;
\q1 he has said to the king, "You will be a priest forever
\q2 like Melchizedek."
\b
\q1

He will judge and punish the people of many nations;
\q2 many bodies of the killed enemy soldiers will lie on the ground.
\q1 He will crush kings all over the earth.
\q1

But the king will drink from the stream alongside the road;
\q2 he will be refreshed after defeating his enemies.

Praise Yahweh!
\b
\q1 I will thank Yahweh with my entire inner being
\q2 every time that those who do what is right come together.
\b
\q1

The things that Yahweh has done are wonderful!
\q1 All those who are delighted with those things
\q2 desire to study them.
\q1

Because he is a great king and does wonderful things,
\q2 people greatly honor him and respect him;
\q1 the righteous things that he does will endure forever.
\q1

By enabling his people to capture the lands that belonged to other people groups,
\q1 he has shown to us, his people, that he is very powerful.
\q1

He does everything fairly, as he has promised us,
\q2 and we can depend on him to help us when he commands us to do things.
\q1

He rescued us, his people, from being slaves in Egypt,
\q2 and he made a covenant with us that will last forever.
\q2 He is holy and awesome!
\b
\q1

Having an awesome respect for Yahweh is the way to become wise.
\q2 All those who obey his commands will know what is good for them to decide to do.
\q2 We should praise him forever!

Praise Yahweh!
\b
\q1 How fortunate are those who have an awesome respect for him,
\q2 those who happily obey his commands.
\b
\q1

Their families will be wealthy,
\q2 and their righteous deeds will endure forever.
\q1

For those who honor God, it is as if a light were shining on them in the darkness,
\q2 on those who are kind, merciful and righteous.
\q1

Things will go well for those who generously lend money to others
\q2 and who conduct their businesses honestly.
\q1

They are confident and not afraid
\q2 because they know that they will see God defeat their enemies.
\q1

They give things generously to poor people;
\q2 their kind deeds will endure forever,
\q2 and they will be exalted and honored.
\b
\q1

Wicked people see those things and are angry;
\q2 they gnash their teeth angrily,
\q2 but they will disappear and die.
\q2 The wicked things that they want to do will never happen.

Praise Yahweh!
\b
\q1 You people who serve Yahweh, praise him!
\q1 Praise him!
\q1

Everyone should praise Yahweh now and forever!
\q1

People who live in the east and people who live in the west,
\q2 everyone, should praise Yahweh!
\b
\q1

Yahweh rules over all the nations,
\q1 and high in the heavens he shows that his glory is very great.
\q1

There is no one who is like Yahweh, our God,
\q2 who lives in the highest heaven
\q2

and looks far down through the heavens and sees the people on the earth.
\b
\q1

and causes them to be honored by sitting next to leaders,
\q2 leaders who rule his own people.
\q1

He also enables women who have no children to live in their houses
\q2 as happy as mothers with children.
\b
\q1 Praise Yahweh!

When the Israelite people left Egypt,
\q1 when the descendants of Jacob left people who spoke a foreign language,
\q2

the land of Judah became the place where people worshiped God;
\q2 and Israel became the land that he ruled over.
\b
\q1

When they came to the Sea of Reeds,
\q1 it was as though the water saw them and ran away!
\q1 When they came to the Jordan River,
\q2 the water in the river stopped flowing so that the Israelites could cross it.
\q1

When they came to Mount Sinai and there was a big earthquake,
\q2 it was as though the mountains skipped like goats
\q2 and the hills jumped around like lambs.
\b
\q1

If someone asks, "What happened at the Sea of Reeds that caused the water to run away?
\q1 What happened that caused the water in the Jordan River to stop flowing?
\q1

What happened that caused the mountains to skip like goats
\q2 and caused the hills to jump around like lambs?"
\b
\q1

Indeed, all the earth will tremble before the Lord!
\q1 Everyone will tremble in the presence of the God whom Jacob worshiped!
\q1

He is the one who caused pools of water to flow from a rock for the Israelite people to drink,
\q2 and he is the one who caused a spring to flow from a solid rock cliff!

\d A psalm written by David
\b
\q1

Yahweh, people should praise you alone;
\q2 they must praise you, not us,
\q2 because you faithfully love us and always do what you have promised to do.
\b
\q1

It is not right that other people groups should say about us,
\q1 "They claim that their God is very powerful,
\q2 but if that is true, why does he not help them?"
\q1

Our God is in heaven,
\q2 and he does whatever he wants!
\q1

But their idols are only statues made of silver and gold,
\q2 things that humans have made.
\q1

They have hands, but they cannot feel anything;
\q2 they have feet, but they cannot walk,
\q2 and they cannot even make any sounds in their throats!
\q1

The people who make those idols are as powerless as those idols,
\q2 and those who trust in those idols can accomplish nothing, just like their idols!
\b
\q1

You, my fellow Israelite people, trust in Yahweh!
\q2 He is the one who helps you and protects you like a shield.
\q1

You priests, descendants of Aaron, trust in Yahweh!
\q2 He is the one who helps you and protects you like a shield.
\q1

All you who have a reverential respect for Yahweh, trust in him!
\q2 He is the one who helps you and protects you like a shield.
\b
\q1

Yahweh has not forgotten us;
\q2 he will bless us Israelite people!
\q2 He will bless the priests,
\q1

and he will bless all those who have a reverential respect for him;
\q2 he will bless important people and people who are considered to be unimportant, everyone!
\b
\q1

I wish that Yahweh may give many children
\q2 to you, my fellow Israelite people, and to your descendants.
\q1

I wish that Yahweh, the one who made heaven and the earth, may bless all of you!
\b
\q1

The highest heavens belong to Yahweh,
\q2 but he gave everything that is on the earth to us people.
\q1

Dead people are not able to praise Yahweh;
\q2 when they descend into the place where dead people are,
\q2 they are unable to speak and cannot praise him.
\q1

But we who are alive will thank him,
\q2 now and forever.
\b
\q1 Praise Yahweh!

I love Yahweh
\q2 because he hears me when I cry to him for help.
\q1

He listens to me,
\q2 so I will call out to him all during my life.
\b
\q1

Everything around me caused me to think that I would die;
\q2 I was very afraid that I would die and go to the place where dead people are.
\q1 I was very distressed and afraid.
\q1

But then I called out to Yahweh, saying,
\q2 "Yahweh, I plead with you to save me!"
\b
\q1

He protects those who are helpless;
\q2 when I thought that I would die, he saved me.
\b
\q1

I must encourage myself
\q2 because Yahweh has done very good things for me.
\b
\q1

Yahweh has saved me from dying
\q2 and has kept me from troubles that would cause me to cry.
\q1 He has kept me from disaster.
\q1

So here on the earth where people are still alive,
\q2 I live, knowing that Yahweh is directing me.
\q1

I continued to believe in Yahweh,
\q2 even when I said, "I am greatly afflicted."
\q1

Even when I was distressed and said, "I cannot trust anyone,"
\q2 I continued to trust in Yahweh.
\b
\q1

So now I will tell you what I will offer to Yahweh
\q2 because of all the good things that he has done for me.
\q1

I will offer to him a cup of wine
\q2 to thank him for saving me.
\q1

When I am together with many people who belong to Yahweh,
\q2 I will give to him the offerings that I solemnly promised to give to him.
\b
\q1

Yahweh is very grieved when one of his people dies.
\q1

I am one of those who serves Yahweh;
\q2 I serve him like my mother did.
\q2 He has ended my troubles..
\b
\q1

So I will offer to him a sacrifice to thank him,
\q1 and I will pray to him.
\q1

18-19 When I am together with many of the people who belong to Yahweh
\q2 in the courtyard outside his temple in Jerusalem,
\q2 I will give to him the offerings that I solemnly promised to give to him.
\b
\q1 Praise Yahweh!

You people of all nations, praise Yahweh!
\q1 All you people groups, praise him
\q2

because he faithfully loves us as he promised to do,
\q2 and he will forever do for us what he promised that he would do.
\b
\q1 Praise Yahweh!

Tell Yahweh that you thank him very much for the good things that he has done for you!
\q2 He faithfully loves us, his people, forever.
\b
\q1

You Israelite people should repeatedly shout,
\q2 "He faithfully loves us, his people, forever!"
\q1

You priests who are descendants of Aaron should repeatedly shout,
\q2 "He faithfully loves us, his people, forever!"
\q1

All you who revere him should repeatedly shout,
\q2 "He faithfully loves us, his people, forever!"
\b
\q1

When I was distressed, I called out to Yahweh,
\q2 and he answered me and set me free from my worries.
\q1

Yahweh is on my side,
\q2 so I will not be afraid of anything.
\q2 No one can do anything that will prevent God from blessing me forever.
\q1

Yes, Yahweh is on my side,
\q2 so I will look triumphantly at my enemies while he defeats them.
\b
\q1

It is better to trust in Yahweh
\q2 than to depend on people.
\q1

It is better to trust Yahweh to protect us
\q2 than to trust that influential people will protect us.
\b
\q1

Armies of many nations surrounded us,
\q2 but Yahweh enabled us to defeat them by his power.
\q1

They completely surrounded us,
\q2 but we defeated them all by Yahweh's power.
\q1

They swarmed around me like angry bees;
\q2 they were like a fire that flares up in a thornbush,
\q2 but we defeated them by Yahweh's power.
\b
\q1

Our enemies attacked us fiercely and almost defeated us,
\q2 but Yahweh helped us.
\q1

Yahweh is the one who makes me strong,
\q1 and he is the one about whom I always sing;
\q2 he has saved us from my enemies.
\b
\q1

he has raised his strong right arm to show he is happy over defeating his enemies.
\q2 Yahweh has completely defeated them!"
\b
\q1

Yahweh has punished me severely,
\q2 but he has not allowed me to die.
\b
\q1

You gatekeepers, open for me the gates of the temple
\q2 so that I may enter and thank Yahweh.
\q1

Yahweh, I thank you that you answered my prayer
\q2 and that you saved me from my enemies.
\b
\q1

Yahweh's chosen king is like a stone that the builders rejected
\q2 when they were building a house,
\q1 but that stone became the cornerstone.
\q1

This was done by Yahweh,
\q1 and it is a wonderful thing for us to see.
\q1

Yahweh, we plead with you to keep rescuing us from our enemies.
\q2 Yahweh, please help us accomplish what we want to do.
\q1

Yahweh, bless the one who will come with your power.
\q2 From the temple we bless all of you.
\q1

Yahweh is God,
\q2 and he has caused his light to come to us.
\q1 Come, bring animal sacrifice and tie it to the horns of the altar.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you are the God whom I worship, and I will praise you!
\q2 You are my God, and I will tell everyone that you are great!
\b
\q1

Thank Yahweh because he does good things for us!
\q2 He will faithfully love us forever as he has promised.

How fortunate are those about whom no one can say truthfully that they have done things that are wrong,
\q1 those who always obey the laws of Yahweh.
\q1

How fortunate are those who obey his weighty commands,
\q1 those who request him with their entire inner beings to help them to do that.
\q1

Yahweh, you have given us your principles of behavior,
\q2 and you told us to obey them faithfully.
\q1

I want so much to faithfully keep everything that you command.
\q1

If I did that, I would not be ashamed
\q2 when I thought about your commands.
\q1

When I learn all of your just regulations,
\q2 I will praise you with a pure inner being.
\q1

I have memorized your commands
\q2 so that I will not sin against you.
\q1

I have announced to the people all the things that you have commanded us to do.
\q1

I will study everything you have commanded,
\q2 and I will pay attention to how you have shown me to live.
\q1

I will be happy to obey your statutes,
\q2 and I will not forget your words.
\q1

Do good things for me, the one who serves you,
\q2 so that I may continue to live and obey your words during all my life.
\q1

Help me to understand with my mind,
\q2 to know the wonderful things that are written in your laws.
\q1

In my inner being I strongly desire to know your decrees all the time.
\q1

Rulers gather together and plan ways to harm me,
\q2 but I will meditate on what you have commanded.
\q1

I am delighted with your requirements;
\q2 it is as though they were my advisors.
\b
\q1

Help me to understand how you want me to behave,
\q2 and then I will meditate on your amazing instructions.
\q1

Prevent me from telling lies,
\q2 and be kind to me by teaching me your laws.
\q1

I will eagerly obey your commands
\q2 because you have helped me understand better and better what you want me to do.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, teach me the meaning of your statutes,
\q2 and then I will completely obey them.
\q1

Help me to understand your laws
\q2 so that I may obey them with all my inner being.
\q1

I am happy with your commands,
\q2 so lead me along the paths that you have chosen for me.
\q1

Cause me to want to do what you command
\q2 and not to want to become rich.
\q1

Because I am one who serves you, do what you promised to do for me,
\q2 which is what you also promise to do for all those who honor you.
\q1

I become afraid when my enemies insult me;
\q2 stop them!
\q2 But you are right when you punish my enemies.
\q1

I very much desire to obey your principles of behavior;
\q2 because you are righteous, allow me to continue to live.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, show me that you faithfully love me,
\q2 and rescue me as you promised you would.
\q1

After you do that, I will be able to reply to those who insult me
\q2 because I trust in your word.
\q1

Never prevent me from speaking your truth
\q2 because I have confidence in your regulations.
\q1

I will always obey your laws
\q2 forever and ever.
\q1

I will always be safe
\q2 because I have tried to obey your principles of behavior.
\q1

I will tell to kings what you require,
\q2 and because they are unable to prove me wrong, they will not cause me to be ashamed.
\q1

I am delighted to obey your commands,
\q2 and I love them.
\q1

I respect your commandments,
\q2 and I love them;
\q2 I will meditate on everything you require us to do.
\b
\q1

Do not forget what you said you would do for me, the one who serves you,
\q2 because what you have said has caused me to confidently expect good things from you.
\q1

Proud people are always making fun of me,
\q2 but I do not turn away from obeying your laws.
\q1

Yahweh, when I think about your regulations that you gave to us long ago,
\q2 I am comforted.
\q1

When I see wicked people disregard your laws,
\q2 I become very angry.
\q1

While I have been living here on the earth for a short time,
\q2 I have written songs about your statutes.
\q1

Yahweh, during the night I think about you,
\q2 and so I obey your laws.
\q1

What I have always done is to obey your principles of behavior.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you are the one whom I have chosen,
\q2 and I promise to obey your words.
\q1

I have thought about my behavior,
\q2 and I have decided to return to obeying your requirements.
\q1

Wicked people have tried to seize me as a hunter tries to catch an animal with a net,
\q2 but I do not forget your laws.
\q1

In the middle of the night I awake,
\q2 and I praise you for your commands
\q2 because they are fair.
\q1

I am a friend of all those who have an awesome respect for you,
\q2 those who obey your principles of behavior.
\q1

Yahweh, you faithfully love people all over the earth;
\q2 teach me your statutes.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you have done good things for me
\q2 as you promised that you would do.
\q1

Teach me to think carefully before I decide what to do,
\q2 and teach me other things that I need to know
\q2 because I believe that it is right for us to obey your commands.
\q1

Before you afflicted me, I did things that were wrong,
\q2 but now I obey your words.
\q1

Proud people have told many lies about me,
\q2 but as for me, I obey your principles of behavior.
\q1

Those people are stubborn,
\q2 but as for me, I am delighted with your laws.
\q1

It was good for me that you afflicted me
\q2 because the result was that I learned your statutes.
\q1

The laws that you give to us are worth more to me than gold,
\q2 more than thousands of pieces of gold and silver.
\b
\q1

Those who have an awesome respect for you will see what you have done for me, 
\q2 because they trust the covenant you made with your people.
\q1

Yahweh, I know that your regulations are right
\q2 and that you have made me suffer because you love me without end.
\q1

Comfort me by showing that you faithfully love me
\q2 as you said to me that you would do.
\q1

Act mercifully to me so that I may continue to live
\q2 because I am delighted with your laws.
\q1

Cause those who have an awesome respect for you to come back to me
\q2 so that they may learn what you command.
\q1

Enable me to perfectly obey your statutes
\q2 so that I may not be ashamed because of not doing that.
\b
\q1

My eyes are tired from waiting a long time for you to do what you promised that you would do,
\q2 and I ask, "When will you help me?"
\q1

I have become as useless as a wineskin that is shriveled from hanging a long time in the smoke inside a house,
\q2 but I have not forgotten your statutes.
\q1

How long must I wait?
\q2 When will you punish those who persecute me?
\q1

It is as though proud people, those who do not obey your laws, have dug deep pits for me to fall into.
\q2
\q1

Those people almost killed me,
\q2 but I have not stopped obeying your principles of behavior.
\q1

Because you faithfully love me, allow me to continue to live
\q2 so that I may continue to obey your requirements that you have spoken.
\b
\q1

If I had not been delighted in obeying your laws,
\q2 I would have died because of what I was suffering.
\q1

I will never forget your principles of behavior
\q2 because as a result of my obeying them, you have enabled me to continue to live.
\q1

I belong to you; save me from my enemies
\q2 because I have tried to obey your principles of behavior.
\q1

Wicked men are waiting to kill me,
\q2 but I will think about your requirements.
\q1

I have learned that there is a limit for everything,
\q2 but your commands have no limit.
\b
\q1

I love your laws very much.
\q2 I meditate on them all during the day.
\q1

Because I know your commands
\q2 and because I think about them all the time,
\q2 I have become wiser than my enemies.
\q1

I understand more than my teachers do
\q2 because I meditate on what you command.
\q1

I understand more than many old people do
\q2 because I obey your principles of behavior.
\q1

I have avoided all evil behavior
\q2 so that I may obey your words.
\q1

I have not refused to obey them
\q2 because you have taught me while I have studied them.
\q1

When I read your words,
\q2 they are like honey that I eat;
\q2 yes, they are even sweeter than honey.
\q1

Because I have learned your principles of behavior,
\q2 I am able to understand many things;
\q2 therefore I hate all evil things that some people do.
\q1

I have solemnly promised, and I am solemnly promising it again,
\q2 that I will always obey your regulations;
\q2 they are all fair.
\q1

Yahweh, when I thank you while I pray, it is like a sacrifice to you;
\q2 please accept it,
\q2 and teach me your regulations.
\q1

My enemies are often trying to kill me,
\q2 but I do not forget your laws.
\q1

Wicked people have tried to seize me as a hunter tries to catch little animals with a trap,
\q2 but I have not disobeyed your principles of behavior.
\q1

I have decided to always obey your commands, every one of them.
\b
\q1

I hate people who only say they love you,
\q2 but I love your laws.
\q1

You are like a place where I can hide from my enemies,
\q2 and you are like a shield behind which I am protected from them;
\q2 I trust in your promises.
\q1

You evil people, go away from me
\q2 so than I may obey my God's commands!
\q1

Enable me to be strong as you promised that you would do,
\q2 so that I may continue to live.
\q1 I am confidently expecting that you will restore me;
\q2 do not disappoint me.
\q1

Hold me up so that I may be safe
\q2 and always pay attention to your commands.
\q1

I tremble because I am afraid of you;
\q2 I am afraid because you punish those who do not obey your regulations.
\b
\q1

Be responsible for doing good things for me,
\q2 and do not allow proud people to oppress me.
\q1

My eyes are tired from waiting a long time for you to rescue me,
\q2 for you to save me as you promised that you would.
\q1

Do something for me to show that you faithfully love me,
\q2 and teach me your statutes.
\q1

I am one who serves you;
\q1 enable me to understand what you want me to know
\q2 so that I may learn your requirements.
\q1

Yahweh, now is the time for you to punish people
\q2 because they have disobeyed your laws.
\q1

So I conduct my life by your principles of behavior,
\q2 and I hate all the evil things that some people do.
\b
\q1

When someone explains your words,
\q2 it is as though they are lighting a light;
\q2 what they say causes even people who have not learned your laws to be wise.
\q1

I eagerly desire to know your commands
\q2 as a dog pants with its mouth open, wanting to be fed.
\q1

Listen to me and act kindly to me
\q2 as you do to all those who love you.
\q1

Rescue me from those who oppress me
\q2 so that I may obey your principles of behavior.
\q1

Act kindly toward me
\q2 and teach me your statutes.
\q1

I cry very much
\q2 because many people do not obey your laws.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you are righteous
\q2 and your regulations are just.
\q1

Your requirements are true
\q2 and are all very right and fair.
\q1

I am furious
\q2 because my enemies disregard your words.
\q1

I have found that your promises are dependable,
\q2 and I love them.
\q1

I am not important, and people despise me,
\q2 but I do not forget your principles of behavior.
\q1

You are righteous and you will be righteous forever,
\q2 and your laws will never be changed.
\q1

I constantly have troubles and I am worried,
\q2 but your commands cause me to be happy.
\q1

Your requirements are always fair;
\q2 help me to understand them so that I may continue to live.
\b
\q1

I call out to you,
\q2 "Save me, and I will keep your commandments."
\q1

All during the night I am awake,
\q2 and I meditate on your commands and your promises.
\q1

Yahweh, because you faithfully love me,
\q2 listen to me while I pray;
\q2 keep me safe because I keep your regulations.
\q1

But Yahweh, you are near to me,
\q2 and I know that your commands will never be changed.
\q1

Long ago I found out about your requirements,
\q2 and I know that you intended them to last forever.
\b
\q1

Look at me, see that I am suffering very much, and heal me
\q2 because I do not forget your laws.
\q1

Wicked people do not obey your statutes,
\q2 so you will certainly not save them.
\q1

Many people are my enemies; many people cause me to suffer,
\q2 but I do not neglect your commands.
\q1

When I look at those who are not faithful to you, I am disgusted
\q2 because they do not obey your requirements.
\q1

I can rely on everything that you have said;
\q2 all your regulations will endure forever.
\b
\q1

Rulers persecute me for no reason,
\q2 but in my inner being I have a very awesome respect for your words.
\q1

I am happy about your words,
\q2 as happy as someone who has found a great treasure.
\q1

I thoroughly hate all lies
\q2 but I love your laws.
\q1

I praise you seven times a day
\q2 for your commandments because they are all just.
\q1

Yahweh, I confidently expect that you will rescue me from my troubles,
\q2 and I obey your commands.
\q1

I obey your principles of behavior,
\q2 and you see everything that I do.
\b
\q1

Hear me while I pray,
\q2 and rescue me as you said you would.
\q1

I will always praise you
\q2 because you teach me your rules.
\q1

I will sing about your words
\q2 because all your commands are just.
\q1

I request you to always be ready to help me
\q2 because I have chosen to obey your principles of behavior.
\q1

Allow me to continue to live in order that I can continue to praise you
\q2 so that your regulations will continue to help me.
\q1

I have sinned and turned away from you like a sheep that has left its flock;
\q2 search for me because I have not forgotten your commands.

\d A psalm written for people going up to the temple to worship
\b
\q1

When I was distressed, I called out to Yahweh
\q2 and he answered me.
\q1

I prayed,
\q2 "Yahweh, rescue me from those who lie to me and try to deceive me!"
\b
\q1

You people who lie to me, I will tell you what God will do to you
\q2 and what he will do to punish you.
\q1

He will punish you when soldiers shoot sharp arrows at you;
\q2 arrows that were hardened and made sharp 
\q2 over hot coals from the wood of a broom tree.
\b
\q1

It is terrible for me, living among cruel people
\q2 like those who live in the regions of Meshech or Kedar.
\q1

I have lived for a long time among people who hate to live with others peacefully.
\q1

Every time I talk about living together peacefully,
\q2 they talk about starting a war.

When we travel toward Jerusalem,
\q2 I look up toward the hills and I ask myself, "Who will help me?"
\q1

My answer is that Yahweh is the one who helps me;
\q2 he is the one who made heaven and the earth.
\b
\q1

The one who protects us Israelite people
\q2 never gets sleepy or sleeps.
\b
\q1

He will not allow the sun to harm us during the day,
\q2 and he will not allow the moon to harm us during the night.
\b
\q1

He will protect us from the time that we leave our houses in the morning until we return in the evening;
\q2 he will protect us now and he will protect us forever.

\d A psalm written by David for people going up to the temple to worship.
\b
\q1

I was glad when people said to me,
\q2 "We should go to the temple of Yahweh in Jerusalem!"
\q1

Now we are here,
\q2 standing inside the gates of Jerusalem.
\q1

We can see that Jerusalem was a carefully built city. 
\q2 Every part of the city was built to fit together 
\q2 within the city as a whole.  
\q1

We people of the tribes of Israel 
\q2 who belong to Yahweh can now go up there,
\q2 as Yahweh commanded that we should do,
\q2 so we can thank him.
\q1

There are the thrones, 
\q2 the thrones that the kings of Israel sat 
\q2 when they ruled Israel.  
\q2 These are the thrones of the descendants of King David.
\b
\q1

Pray that there will be peace in Jerusalem!
\q1 "I pray that those who love Jerusalem will succeed in life.
\q1

I pray that there may be peace inside the walls of the city
\q2 and that people who are inside the palaces may be safe"
\q1

For the sake of my relatives and friends,
\q2 "I pray that people will live peacefully inside Jerusalem."
\q1

And because I love the temple of Yahweh our God,
\q2 "I pray that things will go well for the people who live in Jerusalem."

\d A psalm written for people going up to the temple to worship
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I look up toward you,
\q2 up to heaven, from where you rule.
\q1

As servants ask their masters for what they need
\q1 and as maids ask their mistresses for what they need,
\q2 we ask you, Yahweh our God, for what we need,
\q2 until you act mercifully toward us.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, act very mercifully toward us
\q2 because our enemies have acted very contemptuously toward us.
\q1

Arrogant people have made fun of us for a long time,
