\q2 and proud people have oppressed us and have acted as though we were worthless.

\d A psalm written by David for people going up to the temple to worship.
\b
\q1

You Israelite people, answer this question:
\q1 What would have happened to us if Yahweh had not been helping us?
\q1

When our enemies attacked us,
\q1 if Yahweh had not been fighting for us,
\q1

we would have all been killed
\q2 because they were very angry with us!
\q1

and we would all have drowned in the flood.
\b
\q1

But we praise Yahweh
\q2 because he has not allowed our enemies to destroy us.
\q1

We have escaped from our enemies as a bird escapes from the trap that hunters have set;
\q1 it is as though the trap that our enemies set for us was broken
\q2 and we have escaped from it!
\q1

Yahweh is the one who helps us;
\q2 he is the one who made heaven and the earth.

\d A psalm written for people going up to the temple to worship.
\b
\q1

Those who trust in Yahweh are like Mount Zion,
\q2 which cannot be shaken or moved out of its place.
\q1

As the hills that surround Jerusalem protect it,
\q2 so Yahweh protects us, his people,
\q2 and he will protect us forever.
\b
\q1

Wicked people should not be allowed to rule over the land where righteous people live.
\q2 If they did that, those righteous people would think of doing wrong themselves.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, do good things to those who do good things to others
\q2 and to those who sincerely obey your commands.
\q1

But when you punish the Israelites who no longer obey you,
\q2 you will punish them the same as you punish all the other evildoers.
\b
\q1 I wish that things may go well for people in Israel!

\d A psalm written for people going up to the temple to worship.
\b
\q1

When Yahweh made Jerusalem prosperous again,
\q1 it was wonderful;
\q2 it seemed as though we were dreaming.
\q1

We were extremely happy,
\q1 and we continued shouting joyfully.
\q1 Then the other people groups said about us,
\q2 "Yahweh has done great things for them!"
\q1

We said, "Yes, Yahweh truly has done great things for us,
\q2 and we are very happy."
\b
\q1

Restore us, O Yahweh, like the rains that fill the streams in the southern Judean wilderness.
\q2 Enable our nation to become great again like it was before.
\q1

Those who cried as they carried the bags of seeds to the fields will shout joyfully
\q2 when they bring the crops to their houses at harvest time.

\d A psalm written by Solomon for people going up to the temple to worship.
\b
\q1

If people are building a house without Yahweh helping them,
\q2 they are building it in vain.
\q1 Similarly, if Yahweh does not protect a city,
\q2 it is useless for guards to stay awake at night.
\q1

It is also useless to arise very early and go to sleep late at night
\q2 so that you can work hard all day to earn money to buy food
\q1 because Yahweh gives food to those whom he loves even while they sleep.
\b
\q1

If a man has sons while he is still young,
\q1 when they grow up, they will be able to help him defend his family
\q2 as a soldier can defend himself if he has a bow and arrows in his hand.
\q1

How fortunate is a man who has many sons;
\q2 he is like a soldier who has many arrows in his quiver.
\q1 If a man with his many grown sons is taken by his enemies to the place where they decide matters, his enemies will never be able to defeat that man
\q2 because his sons will help to defend him.

\d A psalm written for those going up to the temple to worship.
\b
\q1

How fortunate are you who have an awesome respect for him
\q2 and do what he wants you to do.
\q1

Like that, Yahweh will bless every man who has an awesome respect for him.
\b
\q1

I wish that God in his temple on Mount Zion may help you greatly,
\q1 and that you will see the people of Jerusalem prospering every day that you live!
\q2

I wish that you may live many years
\q2 and that you may have grandchildren and be able to see them.
\b
\q1 I wish that things may go well for people in Israel!

I say that my enemies have afflicted me ever since I was young.
\q1 Now I ask you, my fellow Israelites, to repeat those same words:
\q1

"Our enemies have afflicted us since our nation began,
\q2 but they have not defeated us!
\q1

Our enemies struck us with whips that cut into our backs 
\q as a farmer uses a plow to cuts deep furrows into the ground."
\q1

But Yahweh is righteous,
\q2 and he has freed us from being slaves to wicked people.
\b
\q1

I wish that they may all be shamed because we will defeat them—all of Jerusalem's enemies.
\q1

no one wants to cut it and tie it up as bundles and carry it away.
\q1

People who pass by and see men harvesting grain usually greet them by saying to them,
\q2 "We wish that Yahweh may bless you!"
\q1 But this will not happen to the enemies of Israel.
\q1 We, acting as Yahweh's representatives, bless you, our fellow Israelites!

\d A psalm written for people going up to the temple to worship.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I have great troubles, so I call out to you.
\q1

Yahweh, hear me
\q2 while I call out to you to have mercy on me!
\b
\q1

Yahweh, if you kept a record of the sins that we have committed,
\q2 not one of us would escape from being condemned and punished!
\q1

But you forgive us,
\q2 with the result that we have an awesome respect for you.
\b
\q1

I wait for Yahweh to help me
\q2 more than watchmen wait for the morning to come;
\q2 yes, I wait more eagerly than they do!
\b
\q1

You, my fellow Israelites, confidently expect that Yahweh will bless us.
\q2 He will bless us because he has mercy on us,
\q2 and he is very willing to save us.
\q1
It is he who will save us Israelite people from being punished for all the sins that we have committed.

\d A psalm written by David for people going up to the temple to worship.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I am not proud;
\q2 I do not deserve to achieve impressive things in life.
\q1 I do not worry about problems that are too difficult for me to solve.
\q1

Instead, I am calm and peaceful in my inner being
\q2 like a small child who no longer nurses but is happy to be with its mother.
\q2 In the same way, I am peaceful within my inner being.
\b
\q1

You, my fellow Israelites, confidently expect that Yahweh will do good things for you
\q2 now and forever!

\d A song to sing along the road up to Jerusalem.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, do not forget King David
\q2 and all the hardships he endured!
\b
\q1

He made a solemn promise to you,
\q2 the mighty God whom our ancestor Jacob worshiped.
\q1

He said, "I will not go home,
\q1 I will not rest on my bed,
\q1

until I build a place for Yahweh,
\q2 a home for the mighty God whom Jacob worshiped."
\b
\q1

In Ephrathah we heard where the sacred chest was.
\q2 So we went and found it near the city of Kiriath Jearim, and we took it to Jerusalem.
\q1

Yahweh, come to the place where you live eternally,
\q2 to the place where your sacred chest is,
\q2 to the place that shows that you are very powerful.
\q1

I want that the righteous behavior of your priests will always be evident,
\q1 and that your people will always shout joyfully.
\b
\q1

You chose David to serve you as king of Israel;
\q2 do not reject him!
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you made a solemn promise to David,
\q2 a promise that you will not break.
\q1 You said, "I will cause your descendants to rule as kings like you.
\q2

If they obey my covenant with them
\q2 and obey all the commands that I will give them,
\q1 the line of kings descended from you will never end."
\b
\q1

I will cause the priests to behave in a manner worthy of ones whom I have saved;
\q2 and all my people who live there will shout joyfully.
\b
\q1

There in Jerusalem I will cause one of David's descendants to become a great king;
\q2 he also will be my chosen king,
\q1 It is there that I will make David's line of descendants continue.
\q1

I will defeat his enemies and cause them to be very ashamed;
\q2 but the crown that my king wears will always shine."

\d A psalm written for people going up to the temple to worship.
\b
\q1

It is very good and very pleasant
\q2 for God's people to gather together in peace.
\q1

It is as delightful as the precious oil
\q2 that ran down from the high priest Aaron's head onto his beard when Moses anointed him,
\q2 that ran down onto the collar of his robes.
\q1

Gathering together in peace is as delightful as the dew that falls on Mount Hermon
\q2 and the dew that falls on Mount Zion.
\q1 Yahweh has promised to bless his people there in Jerusalem
\q2 by making their nation last forever.

\d A psalm written for people going up to the temple to worship.
\b
\q1

All you people who serve Yahweh,
\q2 who stand up and serve him at night in his temple,
\q1 come and praise him!
\q1

Lift up your hands to pray to him in the temple
\q2 and praise him!
\b
\q1

I hope that Yahweh, who created heaven and the earth,
\q2 may bless you from where he lives in the temple on Mount Zion!

Praise Yahweh!
\q1 You who worship Yahweh,
\q1 praise him!
\q1

You who stand at the temple of Yahweh our God in its courtyards, ready to serve him,
\q2 praise him !
\q1

He has chosen us, the descendants of Jacob;
\q2 he has chosen us Israelites to belong to him.
\b
\q1

Yahweh does whatever he desires to do
\q2 in heaven, on the earth,
\q2 and in the seas, down to the bottom of the seas.
\q1

He is the one who causes clouds to appear from very distant places on the earth;
\q2 he makes lightning bolts to flash with the rain,
\q2 and he brings the winds from the places where he stores them.
\b
\q1

He is the one who killed all the firstborn males in Egypt,
\q2 the firstborn of people and of animals.
\q1

There he performed many kinds of miracles 
\q2 to punish the king and all his officials.
\q1

He attacked many nations
\q2 and killed the powerful kings who ruled them:
\q1

Sihon, the king of the Amor people group,
\q2 Og, the king of Bashan,
\q2 and all the other kings in the land of Canaan.
\q1

Yahweh gave us their land,
\q2 so that it would belong to us, his people Israel, forever.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, your name will endure forever,
\q2 and people who are not yet born will remember the great things that you have done.
\q1

Yahweh declares that we, his people, are innocent,
\q2 and he acts mercifully toward us.
\b
\q1

But the idols that the other people groups worship are only statues made of silver and gold,
\q2 things that humans have made.
\q1

They have ears, but they cannot hear anything,
\q2 and they are not even able to breathe.
\q1

The people who make those idols are as powerless as those idols,
\q2 and those who trust in those idols can accomplish no more than their idols can!
\b
\q1

My fellow Israelites, praise Yahweh!
\q1 You priests who are descended from Aaron, praise Yahweh!
\q1

You men who are descended from Levi, you who assist the priests, praise Yahweh!
\q1 All you who have a reverential respect for Yahweh, praise him!
\q1

Praise Yahweh in the temple on Mount Zion in Jerusalem
\q2 where he lives!
\b
\q1 Praise Yahweh!

Thank the Lord who is greater than all other lords;
\q2 he will love us forever as he has promised.
\b
\q1

He created the moon and stars to shine during the nighttime;
\q2 he will love us forever as he has promised.
\b
\q1

With his strong hand he led them out;
\q2 he will love us forever as he has promised.
\b
\q1

But he caused the king of Egypt and his army to drown in it;
\q2 he will love us forever as he has promised.
\b
\q1

He gave those lands to us people of Israel, who serve him;
\q2 he will love us forever as he has promised.
\b
\q1

He is the one who gives food to all living creatures;
\q2 he will love us forever as he has promised.
\b
\q1

So thank God, who lives in heaven
\q2 because he will love us forever as he has promised.!

When we had been taken to Babylonia far from Jerusalem,
\q1 we sat down by the rivers there,
\q2 and we cried when we thought about the temple on Mount Zion in Jerusalem.
\q1

On the willow trees alongside the rivers we hung our harps
\q2 because we did not want to play them anymore and because we were very sad.
\q1

The soldiers who had captured us and taken us to Babylonia forced us to sing for them;
\q2 they told us to entertain them; they said,
\q2 "Sing for us one of the songs that you previously sang in Jerusalem!"
\q1

But we thought to ourselves,
\q2 "We are sad because we have been punished by Yahweh and brought to this foreign land;
\q2 we cannot sing songs about Yahweh while we are here!"
\b
\q1

If I forget about Jerusalem, I hope that my right hand will wither
\q2 so that I will be unable to play my harp!
\q1

I hope that I will not be able to sing again
\q1 if I forget about Jerusalem,
\q2 if I do not consider that Jerusalem causes me to be more joyful than anything else does.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, punish the people of the Edom people group
\q2 for what they did on the day that the army of Babylon captured Jerusalem.
\q1 Do not forget that they said,
\q2 "Tear down all the buildings! Destroy them completely! Leave only the foundations!"
\b
\q1

How fortunate are those who take your babies
\q2 and smash them to pieces on the rocks.

\d A psalm written by David.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I thank you with all my inner being.
\q1 I sing to praise you, even though many people worship idols.
\q1

When I look toward your sacred temple, I bow down
\q2 and thank you because you faithfully love us and do all that you have promised.
\q2 You have given cause for people everywhere to honor you and what you have said more than anything else.
\q1

When I called out to you, you answered me;
\q2 you enabled me to be strong and brave.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, someday all the kings of this earth will praise you
\q2 because they will have heard what you have said.
\q1

They will sing about what you have done;
\q2 they will sing and say that you are very great.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you are supreme,
\q2 but you take care of people who are considered to be unimportant.
\q1 However, you do not show yourself to proud people as faithful.
\q1

When I am in the middle of many troubles,
\q2 you save me.
\q1 With your hand you rescue me from my enemies who are angry at me.
\q1

\d A psalm written by David for the choir director.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you have examined what is in my inner being,
\q2 and you know everything about me.
\q1

You know when I sit down and when I stand up.
\q1 Even though you are far away from me,
\q2 you know what I am thinking.
\q1

From the time that I rise in the morning until I lie down to sleep at night,
\q2 you know everything that I do.
\q1

Yahweh, even before I say anything,
\q2 you know everything that I am going to say!
\b
\q1

I am not able to understand that you know everything about me.
\q2 That is too hard for me to really understand.
\b
\q1

Where could I go to escape from your Spirit?
\q1 Where could I go to get away from you?
\q1

If I go up to heaven, you will be there.
\q1 If I lie down in the place where the dead people are, you will be there.
\q1

If the sun could carry me across the sky,
\q1 if I flew west and made a place to live on an island in the ocean,
\q1

you would be there also to lead me by your hand,
\q2 and you would help me.
\b
\q1

I could wish for the darkness to hide me,
\q1 or I could wish for the light around me to become darkness.
\q1

But even if that happened, you would still see me.
\q1 For you the night is as bright as the daytime,
\q2 because daylight and darkness are no different to you.
\b
\q1

I praise you because you made my body very awesomely and wonderfully.
\q1 Everything that you do is amazing!
\q2 I certainly know that very well.
\q1

When my body was being formed,
\q1 while it was being put together where no one else could see it,
\q2 you saw it!
\q1

You saw me before I was born.
\q1 You wrote in your book the number of days that you had decided that I would live.
\q2 You did that before any of those days had even started!
\b
\q1

God, what you think about me is very valuable.
\q2 There are a huge amount of things that you think about.
\q1

If I could count them, I would see that they are more than the grains of sand at the seashore.
\q1 When I awake, I am still with you.
\b
\q1

God, I wish that you would kill the wicked people!
\q2 I wish that violent men would all leave me.
\q1

Yahweh, I certainly hate those who hate you!
\q2 I despise those who rebel against you.
\q1

I hate them completely,
\q2 and I consider that they are my enemies.
\b
\q1

Find out whether there is anything evil in my inner being,
\q2 and lead me along the road that leads to my being with you forever.

They are always planning to do evil things,
\q2 and they are always encouraging people to start quarrels.
\q1

By what they say, they injure people as poisonous snakes do.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, protect me from the power of wicked people.
\q2 Keep me safe from violent men who plan to ruin me.
\q1

I say to you, "Yahweh, you are my God.
\q2 Listen to me while I cry out to you to help me."
\q1

Yahweh, do not give to wicked people the things that they desire,
\q2 and do not allow them to do the evil things that they plan to do.
\b
\q1

Cause burning coals to fall on their heads!
\q2 Cause them to be thrown into deep pits from which they cannot climb out!
\q1

Do not allow those who slander others to succeed;
\q2 cause evil things to happen to violent men and destroy them!
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I know that you will defend those who are oppressed,
\q2 and that you will do what is just.
\q1

Righteous people will surely thank you,
\q2 and they will live in your presence.

\d A psalm written by David.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I call out to you;
\q2 please help me quickly!
\q1 Listen to me when I am calling to you.
\q1

Accept my prayer as though it were incense being burned as an offering to you.
\q2 Accept me while I lift up my hands to pray to you,
\q2 just as you accept sacrifices that are offered to you in the evening.
\b
\q1

Prevent me from wanting to do anything that is wrong
\q2 and from joining with wicked men when they want to do evil deeds.
\q1 Do not even allow me to share in eating delightful food with them!
\b
\q1

When their rulers are thrown down from the top of rocky cliffs,
\q2 they will know that what I am saying here is good.
\q1

They will know one day that their bodies will lie scattered on the ground in the place of the dead,
\q2 just as one scatters clods of earth when he plows a field.
\b
\q1

But Yahweh God, I continue to request that you help me.
\q2 I ask you to protect me;
\q2 do not allow me to die now!
\q1

I wish that wicked people may fall into the traps they have set to catch me
\q2 while I escape from them.

\d A psalm that David prayed when he was hiding in a cave.
\b
\q1

When I am very discouraged,
\q2 you know what I should do.
\b
\q1 Wherever I walk, it is as though my enemies have hidden traps for me to fall into.
\q1

I look around,
\q2 but there is no one who sees me,
\q2 no one who will protect me,
\q2 and no one who cares about what happens to me.
\b
\q1

Listen to me while I cry out to you for help
\q2 because I am very distressed.
\q1 Rescue me
\q2 because those who make me suffer are very strong;
\q2 I cannot escape from them.
\q1

Free me from my troubles
\q2 so that I may thank you.
\b
\q1 If you do that, when I am with others who live rightly,
\q2 I will praise you for having been very good to me.

Yahweh, hear me while I pray to you!
\q2 Because you are righteous
\q2 and because you faithfully do what you have promised,
\q2 listen to what I am pleading for you to do for me.
\q1

I am one who worships you;
\q1 do not judge me
\q2 because you do not consider anyone to be completely innocent.
\b
\q1

My enemies have pursued me;
\q2 they have completely defeated me.
\q1 It is as though they have put me in a dark prison
\q1 where I have nothing good to hope for.
\q1

So I am very discouraged in my inner being;
\q2 I am very dismayed.
\b
\q1

I lift up my hands to you while I pray;
\q2 I want very much to be with you as much as I would thirst for water in a vast wilderness.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, I am very discouraged,
\q2 so please answer me right now!
\q1 Do not keep away from me
\q2 because if you do that, I will soon be among those who descend to where the dead people are.
\q1

Every morning cause me to remember that you faithfully love me
\q2 because I trust in you.
\q1 I pray to you;
\q2 show me the things that I should do.
\q1

Yahweh, I have gone to you for you to protect me,
\q2 so rescue me from my enemies.
\q1

You are my God;
\q2 teach me to do what you want me to do.
\q1 I want your good Spirit to show me the right things to do.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, restore me when I am close to dying as you promised to do
\q2 because you are righteous!
\q1

I am one who serves you;
\q1 so because you faithfully love me as you promised to do,
\q2 kill my enemies
\q2 and get rid of all those who oppress me.

\d Written by David
\b
\q1

I praise Yahweh, who is like a huge rock on which I am safe!
\q1 He trains my hands so that I can use them to fight battles;
\q2 he trains my fingers so that I can shoot arrows in a war.
\q1

He is the one who protects me as he promised;
\q2 he is like a fortress in which I am safe,
\q2 he protects me as shields protect soldiers,
\q2 and he gives me refuge.
\q1 He defeats other nations and then puts them under my power.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, we people are so insignificant! Why do you notice us?
\q1 It is amazing to me that you pay attention to humans.
\q1

The time that we live is as short as a puff of wind;
\q2 our time to live disappears as a shadow does.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, tear open the sky and come down!
\q2 Touch the mountains so that smoke may pour out from them!
\q1

Cause lightning to flash with the result that your enemies will run away!
\q2 Shoot your arrows at them and cause them to run away in panic.
\q1

It is as though my enemies are like a flood around me;
\q2 reach your hand down from heaven
\q1 and rescue me from them.
\q1 They are men from foreign countries
\q1

who always tell lies.
\q1 Even when they swear to tell the truth, 
\q2 they tell lies.
\b
\q1

God, I will sing a new song to you,
\q2 and I will play my ten-stringed harp while I sing to you.
\q1

You enable kings to defeat their enemies;
\q2 you rescue those who serve you as I did.
\b
\q1

So I ask you to save me from being killed by the swords that those evil people carry.
\q1 Rescue me from the power of those men from foreign countries
\q2 who always tell lies.
\q1 Even when they swear to tell the truth, 
\q2 they tell lies.
\b
\q1

I wish that our sons may all grow to full adulthood;
\q1 I wish that our daughters may grow up to be as straight and tall
\q2 as the pillars that stand in the corners of palaces.
\q1

I wish that our barns may be full of many different crops.
\q1 I wish that the sheep in our fields may give birth to tens of thousands of baby lambs.
\q1

I wish that our cattle may give birth to many calves
\q2 without having any miscarriages or deaths when they are born.
\q1 I wish that there may not be any time when the people in our streets cry out in distress
\q2 because foreign armies are invading.
\b
\q1

If good things like that happen to a nation,
\q2 the people will be very fortunate.
\q1 How fortunate are those who worship Yahweh as God!

\d A psalm written by David to praise God.
\b
\q1

Every day I will praise you;
\q2 Yes, I will praise you forever.
\b
\q1

I will think about how you are very glorious and majestic,
\q1 and I will meditate on all your wonderful deeds.
\q1

People will speak about your powerful and awesome deeds,
\q2 and I will proclaim that you are very great.
\q1

People will remember and proclaim that you are very good to us,
\q2 and they will sing joyfully that you always act justly.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you are good to everyone,
\q2 and you act mercifully to everything that you have made.
\q1

Yahweh, all the creatures that you made will thank you,
\q2 and all your people will praise you.
\q1

They will tell others that you rule very gloriously as our king
\q2 and that you are very powerful.
\q1

They will do that so that everyone will know about your powerful deeds
\q2 and that you rule over us gloriously.
\q1

You will never stop being king;
\q2 you will rule throughout all generations.
\b
\q1

Yahweh, you help all those who are discouraged,
\q2 and you lift up all those who have lost hope.
\q1

All of the creatures that you made expect that you will provide food for them,
\q2 and you give them food when they need it.
\q1

You give food to all living creatures generously,
\q2 and you cause them to be satisfied.
\b
\q1

Yahweh comes near to all those who call out to him,
\q2 to those who call to him sincerely.
\q1

To all those who have an awesome respect for him he gives what they need.
\q2 He hears them when they cry out to him and saves them.
\q1

Yahweh protects all those who love him,
\q2 but he will get rid of all the wicked people.
\b
\q1

I will always praise Yahweh;
\q2 I wish that all people everywhere may praise him forever, for he does everything perfectly.

Praise Yahweh.
\b
\q1 With my whole inner being I will praise Yahweh.
\q1

I will praise Yahweh as long as I am alive;
\q2 I will sing to praise my God all the rest of my life.
\b
\q1

When they die, their corpses decay and become soil again.
\q2 After they die, they can no longer do the things that they planned to do.
\b
\q1

But how fortunate are those whom God helps, the God whom Jacob worshiped.
\q2 These are the people who confidently expect Yahweh, their God, to help them.
\q1

He is the one who created the heavens and the earth,
\q2 the oceans and all the creatures that are in them.
\q1 He always does what he has promised to do.
\q1

He decides matters fairly for those who are treated unfairly,
\q2 and he provides food for those who are hungry.
\q1 He frees those who are in prison.
\q1

Yahweh enables those who are blind to see again.
\q1 He lifts up those who have fallen down.
\q2 He loves the righteous people.
\q1

Yahweh takes care of those from other countries who live in our land,
\q2 and he helps widows and orphans.
\q2 But he stops wicked people from what they are doing.
\b
\q1

Yahweh will continue to be our king forever;
\q2 you people of Israel, your God will rule forever!
\b
\q1 Praise Yahweh!

Praise Yahweh!
\b
\q1 It is good to sing praises to our God.
\q2 It is a delightful thing to do and the right thing to do.
\b
\q1

Jerusalem was destroyed, but Yahweh is enabling us to build Jerusalem again.
\q2 He is bringing back the people who were taken to other lands.
\q1

He enables those who were very discouraged to be encouraged again;
\q2 it is as though they have wounds and he bandages them.
\b
\q1

He has determined how many stars there will be
\q2 and gives names to all of them.
\q1

Yahweh is great and very powerful,
\q2 and no one can measure how much he understands.
\q1

Yahweh lifts up those who have been oppressed,
\q2 and he throws the wicked down to the ground.
\b
\q1

He covers the sky with clouds,
\q2 and then he sends rain to the earth
\q2 and causes grass to grow on the hills.
\q1

He gives to animals the food that they need;
\q2 he gives food to young crows when they cry out because they are hungry.
\b
\q1

He is not impressed with strong horses
\q2 or with men who can run fast.
\q1

Instead, what pleases him are those who have an awesome respect for him,
\q2 those who confidently expect him to continue to love them as he promised to do.
\b
\q1

You people of Jerusalem, praise Yahweh!
\q2 Praise your God!
\q1

He guards your city by keeping its gates strong.
\q1 He blesses the people who live there.
\q1

He causes your people to become wealthy.
\q2 He gives you plenty of very good wheat to eat.
\b
\q1

He sends snow to cover the ground like a white wool blanket,
\q2 and he scatters frost on the ground as wind scatters ashes.
\q1

But he commands the wind to blow, and it blows.
\q2 Then the hail melts and the water flows into the streams.
\b
\q1

He has not done that for any other nation;
\q2 the other nations do not know his laws.
\b
\q1 Praise Yahweh!

Praise Yahweh!
\b
\q1 Praise him, you angels who are in the heavens;
\q2 praise him, you angels up in the sky!
\q1

All you angels who belong to him, praise him!
\q2 All you who are in the armies of Yahweh, praise him!
\q1

Sun and moon, you also must praise him!
\q2 You shining stars, you praise him!
\q1

You highest heavens, praise him!
\q2 You waters that are high above the sky, praise him!
\q1

I want all of these to praise Yahweh 
\q2 because by commanding that they exist, he created them.
\q1

He set them in place;
\q2 he commanded that they should be there forever.
\q2 They cannot disobey that command!
\b
\q1

Everything on the earth, praise Yahweh!
\q2 You huge creatures and everything else that is deep in the ocean,
\q1

fire and hail, snow and frost,
\q2 and strong winds that obey what he commands,
\q1 I tell all of you to praise Yahweh!
\q1

Hills and mountains,
\q2 fruit trees and cedar trees,
\q1

all the wild animals and all tame animals,
\q2 reptiles and other things that creep on the ground,
\q2 and all the birds, I tell all of you to praise Yahweh!
\q1

You kings on this earth and all the people that you rule,
\q2 you princes and all other rulers,
\q1

you young men and young women,
\q2 you old people and children, everyone, praise Yahweh!
\b
\q1

I want them all to praise Yahweh 
\q2 because he is greater than anyone else.
\q2 His power controls everything on the earth and in the heavens.
\q1

He caused us, his people, to be strong
\q2 so that we Israelite people who are very precious to him
\q2 should praise him,
\b
\q1 So praise Yahweh!

Praise Yahweh!
\b
\q1 Sing a new song to Yahweh;
\q2 praise him whenever his faithful people gather together!
\b
\q1

You Israelite people, be glad because of what God, who created you, has done for you!
\q2 You people of Jerusalem, rejoice because of what God, your king, has done for you!
\q1

Praise Yahweh by dancing, by beating tambourines,
\q2 and by playing harps to praise him!
\q1

Because they have won battles, God's people should rejoice
\q2 and sing joyfully all during the night!
\b
\q1

ready to use them to defeat the soldiers of nations that do not worship God
\q1 and to punish the people of those nations.
\q1

They will fasten their kings and other leaders with iron chains.
\q1

They will judge and punish the people of those nations as God wrote should be done.
\q2 Everyone else will honor God's faithful people for doing that!
\b
\q1 Praise Yahweh!

Praise Yahweh!
\b
\q1 Praise God in his temple!
\q2 Praise him who is in his fortress in heaven!
\q1

Praise him by beating drums and by dancing.
\q2 Praise him by playing stringed instruments and by playing flutes!
\q1

Praise him by clashing cymbals;
\q2 praise him by clashing very loud cymbals!
\b
\q1

I want all living creatures to praise Yahweh!
\b
\q1 Praise Yahweh!
